TX Library Help – Version: 00173a, Revision: 165
 ALL  Windows graphics in a sandbox

TXLib.h

См. документацию.

00136 #define _TX_VER      _TX_v_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2021-01-05 12:10:19 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00137 #define _TX_VERSION  _TX_V_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2021-01-05 12:10:19 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00138 #define _TX_AUTHOR   _TX_A_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 168, 2021-01-05 12:10:19 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
00139 
00141 #define _TX_v_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  ((0x##ver##u << 16) | 0x##rev##u)
00142 #define _TX_V_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  "TXLib [Ver: " #ver ", Rev: " #rev ", Date: " #date "]"
00143 #define _TX_A_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2)  "Copyright (C) " auth

00168     #define _GCC_VER          ( __GNUC__*100 + __GNUC_MINOR__*10 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__ )
00169 
00170     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "GNU g++ "            TX_QUOTE (__GNUC__)       "."  \
00171                                                     TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_MINOR__) "."  \
00172                                                     TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) \
00173                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00174 
00175 #elif  defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
00176 
00177     #define _CLANG_VER        ( __clang_major__*100 + __clang_minor__*10 + __clang_patchlevel__ )
00178 
00179     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Clang "              TX_QUOTE (__clang_major__) "."  \
00180                                                     TX_QUOTE (__clang_minor__) "."  \
00181                                                     TX_QUOTE (__clang_patchlevel__) \
00182                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)

00184 
00185     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "MSVS "               TX_QUOTE (_MSC_VER)            \
00186                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00187 
00188 #elif  defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
00189 
00190     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Intel C++ "          TX_QUOTE (__INTEL_COMPILER)    \
00191                               ", std="              TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00192 #else
00193 
00194     #define __TX_COMPILER__   "Unknown C++, std="   TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
00195     #endif

00238 
00239 #define __TX_FILELINE__       __FILE__ " (" TX_QUOTE (__LINE__) ")"
00240 
00241 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00249 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00250 
00251 #if defined (__GNUC__) || defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
00252     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
00253 
00254 #elif defined (__FUNCSIG__)
00255     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCSIG__
00256 
00257 #elif defined (__FUNCTION__)
00258     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCTION__
00259 
00260 #elif defined (__INTEL_COMPILER) && (__INTEL_COMPILER >= 600)
00261     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNCTION__
00262 
00263 #elif defined (__BORLANDC__) && (__BORLANDC__ >= 0x550)
00264     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __FUNC__
00265 
00266 #elif defined (__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 199711L)
00267     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __func__
00268 
00269 #elif defined (__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)
00270     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   __func__
00271 
00272 #elif defined (__PYTHON__)
00273     #error No Python. No. Using parseltongue languages can lead you to Slytherin.
00274 
00275 #else
00276     #define __TX_FUNCTION__   "(" __TX_FILELINE__ ")"
00277 
00278 #endif
00279 
00280 #if !defined (__func__) && defined (__FUNCTION__)
00281     #define   __func__        __FUNCTION__
00282 
00283 #endif
00284

00296     #ifdef __GNUC__
00297     #error
00298     #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00299     #endif
00300     #error TXLib.h: Must use C++ to compile TXLib.h. Now you are using C only.
00301     #error
00302     #error CHECK source file EXTENSION. Maybe it is ".C". It must be ".CPP".
00303     #error If your file is named, for example, "Untitled.C", go to menu [File],
00304     #error then [Save As] and rename it to "Untitled.CPP". Please do NOT use spaces.
00305     #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00306     #error
00307 
00308 #endif

00497         #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
00498     #endif
00499 
00500     #ifndef     _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG                  // TXLib enables _GLIBCXX_DEBUG by default. When using third-party libraries
00501         #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG                   // compiled without _GLIBCXX_DEBUG (SFML, for example), #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
00502         #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG_PEDANTIC          // *before* including TXLib.h.
00503     #endif
00504 
00505     #if defined (_WIN64)                         // removed in x86 because printf ("%lg", double) failure, this prints 0 always
00506     #ifndef     __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
00507         #define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO 1
00508     #endif
00509     #endif
00510 
00511     template <typename T>
00512     inline T _txNOP (T value)          { return value; }   // To suppress performance warnings in assert etc.
00513 
00514     // From MinGW\include\float.h which is replaced by MinGW\lib\gcc\i686-pc-mingw32\x.x.x\include\float.h
00515     extern "C" __declspec (dllimport)  unsigned __cdecl _controlfp (unsigned control, unsigned mask);
00516     extern "C"                         void     __cdecl _fpreset   ();
00517 
00518 #else
00519 
00520     #define     __attribute__( attr )
00521     #define     _txNOP( value )        ( value )
00522 
00523 #endif

00610 #if  defined (_MSC_VER)
00611 
00612     #pragma warning (push, 4)                    // Set maximum warning level. This 'push' is to set the level only. It will NOT be popped.
00613 
00614     #pragma warning (disable:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00615 
00616     #pragma warning (disable:    4514)           // Unreferenced inline function has been removed
00617     #pragma warning (disable:    4710)           // Function not inlined
00618     #pragma warning (disable:    4786)           // Identifier was truncated to '255' characters in the debug information
00619 
00620     #pragma warning (error:      4715)           // Not all control paths return a value
00621 
00622     #pragma warning (default:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning  //-V665
00623 
00624     // These warning settings for TXLib.h only and will be re-enabled at end of file:
00625 
00626     #pragma warning (push)
00627 
00628     #pragma warning (disable:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
00629 
00630     #pragma warning (disable:    4091)           // 'typedef': ignored on left of '...' when no variable is declared
00631     #pragma warning (disable:    4124)           // Using __fastcall with stack checking is ineffective
00632     #pragma warning (disable:    4127)           // Conditional expression is constant
00633     #pragma warning (disable:    4200)           // Nonstandard extension used: zero-sized array in struct/union
00634     #pragma warning (disable:    4201)           // Nonstandard extension used: nameless struct/union
00635     #pragma warning (disable:    4351)           // New behavior: elements of array will be default initialized
00636     #pragma warning (disable:    4480)           // Nonstandard extension used: specifying underlying type for enum 'type'
00637     #pragma warning (disable:    4481)           // Nonstandard extension used: override specifier 'override'
00638     #pragma warning (disable:    4555)           // Result of expression not used
00639     #pragma warning (disable:    4611)           // Interaction between '_setjmp' and C++ object destruction is non-portable
00640     #pragma warning (disable:    5045)           // Compiler will insert Spectre mitigation for memory load if /Qspectre switch specified
00641     #pragma warning (disable:    6269)           // Possibly incorrect order of operations: dereference ignored
00642     #pragma warning (disable:    6285)           // (<non-zero constant>) || (<non-zero constant>) is always a non-zero constant. Did you intend to use bitwize-and operator?
00643     #pragma warning (disable:    6319)           // Use of the comma-operator in a tested expression causes the left argument to be ignored when it has no side-effects
00644     #pragma warning (disable:    6326)           // Potential comparison of a constant with another constant
00645     #pragma warning (disable:   26135)           // Missing locking annotation
00646     #pragma warning (disable:   26400)           // Do not assign the result of an allocation or a function call with an owner<T> return value to a raw pointer, use owner<T> instead (i.11).
00647     #pragma warning (disable:   26401)           // Do not delete a raw pointer that is not an owner<T> (i.11).
00648     #pragma warning (disable:   26403)           // Reset or explicitly delete an owner<T> pointer 'name' (r.3).
00649     #pragma warning (disable:   26408)           // Avoid malloc() and free(), prefer the nothrow version of new with delete (r.10).
00650     #pragma warning (disable:   26409)           // Avoid calling new and delete explicitly, use std::make_unique<T> instead (r.11).
00651     #pragma warning (disable:   26426)           // Global initializer calls a non-constexpr function 'name' (i.22).
00652     #pragma warning (disable:   26429)           // Symbol 'name' is never tested for nullness, it can be marked as not_null (f.23).
00653     #pragma warning (disable:   26430)           // Symbol 'name' is not tested for nullness on all paths (f.23).
00654     #pragma warning (disable:   26432)           // If you define or delete any default operation in the type 'struct 'name'', define or delete them all (c.21).
00655     #pragma warning (disable:   26435)           // Function 'name' should specify exactly one of 'virtual', 'override', or 'final' (c.128).
00656     #pragma warning (disable:   26438)           // Avoid 'goto' (es.76).
00657     #pragma warning (disable:   26440)           // Function 'name' can be declared 'noexcept' (f.6).
00658     #pragma warning (disable:   26446)           // Prefer to use gsl::at() instead of unchecked subscript operator (bounds.4).
00659     #pragma warning (disable:   26447)           // The function is declared 'noexcept' but calls function 'func' which may throw exceptions (f.6).
00660     #pragma warning (disable:   26448)           // Consider using gsl::finally if final action is intended (gsl.util).
00661     #pragma warning (disable:   26451)           // Arithmetic overflow: Using operator 'op' on a n-byte value and then casting the result to a m-byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'op' to avoid overflow (io.2).
00662     #pragma warning (disable:   26455)           // Default constructor may not throw. Declare it 'noexcept' (f.6).
00663     #pragma warning (disable:   26460)           // The reference argument 'stream' for function 'name' can be marked as const (con.3).
00664     #pragma warning (disable:   26461)           // The pointer argument 'name' for function 'name' can be marked as a pointer to const (con.3).
00665     #pragma warning (disable:   26462)           // The value pointed to by 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as a pointer to const (con.4).
00666     #pragma warning (disable:   26475)           // Do not use function style C-casts (es.49).
00667     #pragma warning (disable:   26477)           // Use 'nullptr' rather than 0 or NULL (es.47).
00668     #pragma warning (disable:   26481)           // Don't use pointer arithmetic. Use span instead (bounds.1).
00669     #pragma warning (disable:   26482)           // Only index into arrays using constant expressions (bounds.2).
00670     #pragma warning (disable:   26483)           // Value 'value' is outside the bounds (min, max) of variable 'name'. Only index into arrays using constant expressions that are within bounds of the array (bounds.2).
00671     #pragma warning (disable:   26485)           // Expression 'expr': No array to pointer decay (bounds.3).
00672     #pragma warning (disable:   26486)           // Don't pass a pointer that may be invalid to a function. Parameter 'n' 'name' in call to 'name' may be invalid (lifetime.3).
00673     #pragma warning (disable:   26487)           // Don't return a pointer 'name' that may be invalid (lifetime.4).
00674     #pragma warning (disable:   26488)           // Do not dereference a potentially null pointer: 'name'. 'name' was null at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
00675     #pragma warning (disable:   26489)           // Don't dereference a pointer that may be invalid: 'name'. 'name' may have been invalidated at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
00676     #pragma warning (disable:   26490)           // Don't use reinterpret_cast (type.1).
00677     #pragma warning (disable:   26492)           // Don't use const_cast to cast away const or volatile (type.3).
00678     #pragma warning (disable:   26493)           // Don't use C-style casts (type.4).
00679     #pragma warning (disable:   26496)           // The variable 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as const (con.4).
00680     #pragma warning (disable:   26497)           // The function 'name' could be marked constexpr if compile-time evaluation is desired (f.4).
00681     #pragma warning (disable:   26812)           // The enum type 'type' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3).
00682     #pragma warning (disable:   26814)           // The const variable 'name' can be computed at compile-time. Consider using constexpr (con.5).
00683     #pragma warning (disable:   28125)           // The function must be called from within a try/except block
00684     #pragma warning (disable:   28159)           // Consider using another function instead
00685 
00686     #pragma warning (default:    4616)           // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning  //-V665
00687 
00688     #define _tx_thread          __declspec (thread)
00689     #define _tx_decltype(value)   decltype (value)
00690 
00691     #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
00692 
00693     #pragma setlocale           ("russian")      // Set source file encoding, see also _TX_CODEPAGE
00694 
00695     #if !defined (NDEBUG)
00696         #pragma check_stack     (      on)       // Turn on stack probes at runtime
00697         #pragma strict_gs_check (push, on)       // Detects stack buffer overruns
00698     #endif
00699 
00700     #endif
00701 
00702     #define _CRT_SECURE_CPP_OVERLOAD_SECURE_NAMES  1
00703 
00704 #endif
00705

00707 
00708 #if  defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
00709 
00710     #pragma warning (disable:    174)            // Remark: expression has no effect
00711     #pragma warning (disable:    304)            // Remark: access control not specified ("public" by default)
00712     #pragma warning (disable:    444)            // Remark: destructor for base class "..." is not virtual
00713     #pragma warning (disable:    522)            // Remark: function "..." redeclared "inline" after being called
00714     #pragma warning (disable:    981)            // Remark: operands are evaluated in unspecified order
00715     #pragma warning (disable:   1684)            // Conversion from pointer to same-sized integral type (potential portability problem)
00716 
00717 #endif

00723 
00724     #ifdef __GNUC__
00725     #error

00746     #error

00748     #error nesessary for txSpeak() to work.

00760 #endif                                           //   they are allowed by default if WINVER >= 0x0600.

00771 #define stristrw( str1, str2 )         Win32::StrStrIW ((str1), (str2))

00776 #define __STDC_FORMAT_MACROS           1         // PRIu64 and other PR... macros
00777 #define __STDC_WANT_LIB_EXT1__         1         // String and output *_s functions
00778 
00779 #define _LIBCPP_ENABLE_CXX17_REMOVED_UNEXPECTED_FUNCTIONS  // Wow, how long. Kudos, Clang
00780 
00781 #define _ALLOW_RTCc_IN_STL             1         // MSVC C2338: /RTCc rejects conformant code, so it isn't supported by libc.
00782 
00783 #define NOMINMAX                       1         // Preventing 'min' and 'max' defines in Windows.h
00784 
00785 #if defined (_DEBUG)

00787 #define _HAS_ITERATOR_DEBUGGING        1
00788 #define _LIBCPP_DEBUG                  1
00789 #endif

00795     #define NEW                        new (_NORMAL_BLOCK, __FILE__, __LINE__)

00887 #endif
00888 
00889 #if !defined (_TRUNCATE) || defined (__CYGWIN__) || defined (_MEMORY_S_DEFINED)
00890 
00891     #define  strncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( strncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00892     #define  wcsncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( wcsncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00893     #define  strncat_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count )  ( strncat ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
00894     #define  strerror_s( buf, sizeof_buf, code        )  ( strncpy ((buf), strerror ((int)(code)), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00895     #define  strtok_s(   buf, delim, ctx              )  ( (void)(ctx), strtok ((buf), (delim)) )
00896     #define  fopen_s(    file, name, mode             )  ( *(file) = fopen ((name), (mode)) )
00897     #define _strlwr_s(   str, sizeof_str              )  ( _strlwr (str) )
00898 
00899     #define  ctime_s( buf, sizeof_buf, time    )         ( strncpy ((buf), ctime (time), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00900     #define _controlfp_s( oldCtl, newCtl, mask )         ( assert (oldCtl), *(oldCtl) = _controlfp (newCtl, mask), 0 )
00901 
00902     #define _snprintf_s                                  snprintf
00903     #define _vsnprintf_s( str, sz, trunc, format, arg )  _vsnprintf (str, sz, format, arg)
00904 
00905 #endif
00906 
00907 #if !( defined (_MSC_VER) || defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__) )
00908 
00909     #define  getenv_s( sz, buf, sizeof_buf, name )       ( (void)(sz), strncpy ((buf), getenv (name), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
00910 
00911 #endif
00912 
00913 #if defined (__CYGWIN__)
00914 
00915     #undef   __STRICT_ANSI__
00916 
00917     typedef  void                                _exception;
00918 
00919     #define _O_TEXT                              O_TEXT
00920     #define _fdopen                              fdopen
00921     #define _flushall()                          fflush (NULL)
00922     #define _getcwd                              getcwd
00923     #define _getpid                              getpid
00924     #define _stricmp                             strcasecmp
00925     #define _strlwr                              strlwr

00927     #define _unlink                              unlink

00939      defined (_GCC_VER) && (_GCC_VER == 492) && !defined (_WIN64) // Dev-CPP 5.11: TDM-GCC 4.9.2 MinGW64 with -m32

01367 
01368 const COLORREF
01369 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
01370     enum txColors {
01371 #endif
01372 
01373     TX_BLACK         = RGB (  0,   0,   0),   
01374     TX_BLUE          = RGB (  0,   0, 128),   
01375     TX_GREEN         = RGB (  0, 128,   0),   
01376     TX_CYAN          = RGB (  0, 128, 128),   
01377     TX_RED           = RGB (128,   0,   0),   
01378     TX_MAGENTA       = RGB (128,   0, 128),   
01379     TX_BROWN         = RGB (128, 128,   0),   
01380     TX_ORANGE        = RGB (255, 128,   0),   
01381     TX_GRAY          = RGB (160, 160, 160),   
01382     TX_DARKGRAY      = RGB (128, 128, 128),   
01383     TX_LIGHTGRAY     = RGB (192, 192, 192),   
01384     TX_LIGHTBLUE     = RGB (  0,   0, 255),   
01385     TX_LIGHTGREEN    = RGB (  0, 255, 128),   
01386     TX_LIGHTCYAN     = RGB (  0, 255, 255),   
01387     TX_LIGHTRED      = RGB (255,   0, 128),   
01388     TX_LIGHTMAGENTA  = RGB (255,   0, 255),   
01389     TX_PINK          = RGB (255, 128, 255),   
01390     TX_YELLOW        = RGB (255, 255, 128),   
01391     TX_WHITE         = RGB (255, 255, 255),   
01392     TX_TRANSPARENT   = 0xFFFFFFFF,            
01393     TX_NULL          = TX_TRANSPARENT,        
01394 
01395 //  Цветовые каналы (компоненты) -- см. txExtractColor(), txRGB2HSL(), txHSL2RGB()
01396 
01397     TX_HUE          = 0x04000000,             
01398     TX_SATURATION   = 0x05000000,             
01399     TX_LIGHTNESS    = 0x06000000;             
01400 
01401 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
01402     };
01403 #endif
01404 
01406 #define TX_GREY       TX_GRAY
01407 #define TX_DARKGREY   TX_DARKGRAY
01408 #define TX_LIGHTGREY  TX_LIGHTGRAY
01409

01440 #endif

01981 
01982 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02000 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02001 
02002 inline bool txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
02003     {
02004     (void)x1; (void)y1; (void)x2; (void)y2; (void)x3; (void)y3;
02005 
02006     MessageBox (txWindow(),
02007                "txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)\n\n"
02008                "Эта функция не реализована в библиотеке, потому что вы легко можете реализовать ее сами "
02009                "как функцию с параметрами, используя txPolygon(). См. \"Пример с функциями с параметрами\". "
02010                "Ну или нарисовать тремя линиями. :)",
02011                "TXLib сообщает", MB_ICONINFORMATION);
02012 
02013     return false;
02014     }
02015 
02016 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02018 
02019 bool txNotifyIcon (unsigned flags, const char title[], const char format[], ...) tx_printfy (3);
02020 
02021 #define txRectandle  Sleep (1000), txRectangle  // Copy-protection for the function below
02022 #define txLine(...)  txLine (__VA_ARGS__); {    //
02023 #define txNotifyIcon }}}}}}}}}} txNotifyIcon    // Не спрашивайте, зачем. Это дичь.
02024 #define txCircle     ;txCircle                  //
02025 #define txSetColor   ;txSetColor                //
02026 #define C0L0RREF     COLORREF                   //
02027 #define OxFFFFFF     0xFFFFFF                   //
02028 #define lO           10                         //
02029 #define lOOO         1000                       //
02030 #define O                                       //
02031 
02033 //}
02034 
02035 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
02076 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//////
02077                                                                                                                        //
02078 inline void txDrawMan (int x, int y, int sizeX, int sizeY, COLORREF color, double handL, double handR, double twist,   //
02079                        double head, double eyes, double wink, double crazy, double smile, double hair, double wind)    //
02080     {                                                                                                                  //
02081     const char msg[] = "\0/А я - человечек из библиотеки!\0/Меня объясняли на уроке!\0/Напиши меня сам!\0/";           //
02082     //                   |                                |                          |                  |              //
02083     // Не копипастите! _/ \_ Все равно не получится! :) _/ \_  Человечки защищают  _/ \_ этот код! :) _/ \_  Муаххаха! //
02084     //                                                                                                                 //
02085     static int count = GetTickCount(), L = 0;  
02086 
02087     C0L0RREF lineColor = txGetColor();
02088     C0L0RREF fillColor = txGetFillColor();
02089 
02090     txSetColor     (color, 3);
02091     txSetFillColor (color);
02092 
02093     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x, y - O.7 * sizeY);
02094 
02095     txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2.0, y - (O.7 + handL) * sizeY);
02096     txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y - (O.7 + handR) * sizeY);
02097 
02098     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2.0, y);
02099     txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y);
02100 
02101     txCircle (x, y - (O.85 + head) * sizeY, O.15 * sizeY);
02102 
02103     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x +  wind/lO        * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02104     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO - O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02105     txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO + O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
02106 
02107     txSetColor     (~color & OxFFFFFF);  // Inverse the color
02108     txSetFillColor (~color & OxFFFFFF);
02109 
02110     txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
02111     txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
02112 
02113     txNotifyIcon (4, (const char*)!! (L+'L')[msg], "\n%s\n", msg + ((unsigned) (((count -=- 1) ^=! 1) ^=~ ((0)^(0)) +1) % 3)["\"<"]);  //-V112 //-V542
02114 
02115     // See above: Mouth operator -=-, Cat operator ^=!, Mouse operator ^=~ and Owl constant ((0)^(0)). Use it freely, meow
02116 
02117     txCircle (x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head - O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 + O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
02118     txCircle (x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head + O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 - O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
02119     Sleep (lOOO + count%2);
02120 
02121     txSetColor     ((color == 0xDEADFACE)? TX_DARKGRAY : TX_TRANSPARENT);
02122     txSetFillColor (TX_TRANSPARENT);
02123 
02124     txCircle (x, y, 4);  //-V112
02125     txRectandle (x - sizeX/2.0, y - sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y);
02126 
02127     txSetColor     (lineColor);
02128     txSetFillColor (fillColor);
02129     }
02130 
02132 //}

04133 int txPrintf (const char* format, ArgsT... args);

04136

04144 enum precision_t : int {};
04145 
04146 inline width_t     width     (int width) { return (width_t)     width; }
04147 inline precision_t precision (int prec)  { return (precision_t) prec;  }
04148 
04149 #endif

04232 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04304 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04306 
04307 #define sizearr( arr )  ( sizeof (get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (arr)) )
04308 
04310 //  See explanation here: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/the1/archive/2004/05/07/128242.aspx
04311 
04312 template <typename T, size_t N> char (&get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (T (&) [N])) [N];  // ;=P
04313 
04314 //  Another approach
04315 
04316 #if defined (_TX_CPP11_MSVC15)
04317 template <typename T, size_t N> constexpr size_t countof (const T (&) [N] ) { return N; }
04318 #endif
04319 
04321 
04322 #define SIZEARR( arr )  ( sizeof (arr) / sizeof ((arr)[0]) )
04323

04481 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

04483 #define MAX( a, b )     ( ((a) > (b))? (a) : (b) )
04484 
04485 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04504 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04505 
04506 #define MIN( a, b )     ( ((a) < (b))? (a) : (b) )

04522 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04523 
04524 #if defined (__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L  // MSVC: C99 case
04525 
04526     #define ROUND( x )  ( (long) round (x) )
04527 
04528 #else
04529 
04530     #define ROUND( x )  ( (long) floor ((x) + 0.5) )

04532 #endif

04534 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

04554 
04555 void tx_fpreset();
04556 
04557 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04566 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04567 
04568 const double txPI = asin (1.0) * 2;
04569 
04570 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04597 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04598 
04599 inline double txSqr (double x)
04600     {
04601     double sqr = pow (sqrt (x) * sqrt (x), sqrt (4.0));  // Бурная вычислительная деятельность
04602 
04603     char str[1024] = "";
04604     _snprintf_s (str, sizeof (str), "Возведение дало %g!" "!!" "!!" " Вы рады????", sqr);
04605     txMessageBox (str, "Получен ОТВЕТ!" "!!", MB_ICONEXCLAMATION | MB_YESNO) != IDNO ||
04606         (
04607         txMessageBox ("Жаль...", "А я так старалась", MB_ICONINFORMATION),
04608         txMessageBox ("Уйду я от вас", "Злые вы...",  MB_ICONSTOP),
04609         exit (EXIT_FAILURE), 0  //-V2509 //-V2014
04610         );
04611 
04612     txNotifyIcon (1, NULL, "\n%s\n", "Высшая математика!  \0"  // А как это работает, а?  //-V111
04613                                      "С ума сойти...      \0"  //
04614                                      "а КЭП подтверждает  \0"  //       и кто это будет
04615                                      "Главное - отчитаться\0"  //       поддерживать?..
04616                                      "Невероятно, но факт \0"
04617                                      "Кто бы мог подумать?\0" + GetTickCount() % 6 * 21);
04618 
04619     return sqr;  // Все же вернем значение. Мы же не звери
04620     }
04621 
04622 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04644 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04645 
04646 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
04647 #define _TX_DESTROY_3D
04648 #endif
04649 
04650 #if defined (_TX_DESTROY_3D)
04651 
04652     #define z  0                   // Читайте "Флатландию" Эбботта!
04653 
04654 #endif
04655 
04656 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04673 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04675 
04676 #define please
04677 
04678 #define meow   ;
04679 
04680 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && !defined (_CLANG_VER)
04681 #define мяу    meow
04682 #endif
04683 
04685 
04686 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04704 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04705 
04706 #define ZERO( type )    zero <type> ()
04707 
04709 template <typename T> inline T zero() tx_nodiscard;
04711 
04712 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04739 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04741 
04742 #define  tx_auto_func(    func )  _tx_auto_fun1 ( __LINE__, func )
04743 #define _tx_auto_fun1( n, func )  _tx_auto_fun2 ( n,        func )
04744 #define _tx_auto_fun2( n, func )  auto _tx_auto_func_##n = _tx_auto_func ([&]() { func; })
04745 
04746 #define tx_finally(...)           tx_auto_func (__VA_ARGS__)
04747 
04748 template <typename T>
04749 struct _tx_auto_func_
04750     {
04751     typedef _tx_auto_func_<T> this_t;
04752     T func_;
04753 
04754     explicit _tx_auto_func_ (T func) : func_ (func) {}
04755             ~_tx_auto_func_ ()       { func_ ();     }
04756 
04757     private:         _tx_auto_func_ ()              _tx_delete;
04758                      _tx_auto_func_ (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
04759              this_t& operator =     (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
04760     };
04761 
04762 template <typename T>
04763 _tx_auto_func_<T> _tx_auto_func  (T   func)
04764     {
04765     return        _tx_auto_func_ <T> (func);
04766     }
04767 
04769 
04770 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04815 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04816 
04817 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04818     #undef  TX_ASSERT
04819     #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) _txNOP ( !(cond)? (TX_ERROR ("\a" "ВНЕЗАПНО: Логическая ошибка: " \
04820                                                            "Неверно, что \"%s\"." TX_COMMA #cond), 1/(int)!!(cond)) : 1 )
04821 #else
04822     #undef  TX_ASSERT
04823     #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) ((void) 1)
04824 
04825 #endif
04826 
04827 #ifdef assert
04828     #undef assert
04829 #endif
04830 
04831 #define assert( cond )        TX_ASSERT (cond)
04832 
04833 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04860 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04861 
04862 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04863     #define asserted          || TX_ERROR ("\a" "Обнаружен нулевой или ложный результат.")
04864 
04865 #else
04866     #define asserted          || _txNOP (0)
04867 
04868 #endif
04869 
04870 #define verified              asserted  //!< For compatibility with assert macro
04871 
04873 #define TX_NEEDED             asserted  //!< For compatibility with earlier releases
04874 
04875 
04876 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04904 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04905 
04906 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04907     #undef  verify
04908     #define verify            assert
04909 
04910 #else
04911     #undef  verify
04912     #define verify( expr )    ( expr )
04913 
04914 #endif
04915 
04916 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04935 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04936 
04937 #if !defined (FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY)
04938     #define TX_ERROR( ... )   _txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
04939 #else
04940     #define TX_ERROR( msg )   _txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, msg)
04941 #endif
04942 
04944     #define TX_THROW          TX_ERROR  //!< For compatibility with earlier TXLib releases
04945 
04946 
04947 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04963 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04964 
04965 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
04966     #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...)  TX_ERROR (__VA_ARGS__)
04967 
04968 #else
04969     #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...)  ((void) 0)
04970 
04971 #endif
04972 
04973 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04993 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04994 
04995 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
04996 void txDump (const void* address, const char name[] = "_txDump()", bool pause = true);
04997 #endif
04998 
05000 
05001 #ifdef _MSC_VER
05002 #define txDump( ... )           _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) __VA_ARGS__)
05003 #else
05004 #define txDump( address, ... )  _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) (address), #address, ##__VA_ARGS__)
05005 #endif
05006 
05007 void _txDump (const void* address, const char name[] = "_txDump()", bool pause = true);
05008 
05010 
05011 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05037 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05038 
05039 #define txStackBackTrace()    _txStackBackTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, true);
05040 
05041 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05063 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05065 
05066 std::string txDemangle (const char* mangledName);
05067 char*       txDemangle (const char* mangledName, std::nomeow_t);
05068 
05069 #define txTypename(value)     txDemangle (typeid (value) .name()) .c_str()
05070 
05072 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05099 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05100 
05101 int txRegQuery (const char* keyName, const char* valueName, void* value, size_t szValue);
05102 
05103 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05116 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05118 
05119 #define _                     ,
05120 #define TX_COMMA              ,  //!< Синоним макроса _ (@ref _ "символ подчеркивания")
05121 
05123 
05125 //}

05280 
05281 bool txUnlock();
05282 
05284 template <typename T> inline T txUnlock (T value);
05286 
05288 
05289 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05312 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05313 
05314 #define txGDI( command, dc )  ( ((dc) == txDC())? txUnlock ( (txLock(), (command)) ) : (command) )
05315

05662                                           "starter.exe:eclipse.exe, "               /* 2: Eclipse 4     */ \

05797 //=================================================================================================================
05798 
05799 //=================================================================================================================
05800 //{          Internal diagnostics
05802 //=================================================================================================================
05804 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05844 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05845 
05846 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05847 #define _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
05848 #endif
05849 
05850 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05880 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05881 
05882 #ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05883 #define       TX_TRACE
05884 #endif
05885 
05886 #if !defined (TX_TRACE)
05887     #define   TX_TRACE  { if (_txLoc::Cur.trace) _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__); }
05888 #endif
05889 
05891 void _txTrace (const char file[], int line, const char func[], const char msg[] = NULL, ...);
05893 
05894 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05897 
05898 #ifndef   FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
05899 
05900 struct _txLoc
05901     {
05902     const char*   func;
05903     const char*   file;
05904     int           line;
05905 
05906     int           inTX;   // We are inside one of TXLib functions
05907     int           trace;  // Internal TX trace level, when enabled by _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
05908 
05909     const _txLoc* prev;   // Caller's location
05910 
05911     static _txLoc _tx_thread Cur;
05912     };
05913 
05914 struct _txFuncEntry
05915     {
05916     typedef _txFuncEntry this_t;
05917 
05918     _txLoc loc;
05919 
05920     _txFuncEntry() : loc (_txLoc::Cur) { _txLoc::Cur.inTX++; _txLoc::Cur.prev = &loc; }
05921     void restore()                     { _txLoc::Cur = loc;                           }
05922    ~_txFuncEntry()                     { restore();                                   }
05923 
05924     private:
05925             _txFuncEntry (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
05926     this_t& operator =   (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
05927     };
05928 
05929 #if defined (_GCC_VER)
05930 
05931     inline void __txLocCurSet (const char* _file, int _line, const char* _func)
05932         { _txLoc::Cur.file = _file; _txLoc::Cur.line = _line; _txLoc::Cur.func = _func; }
05933 
05934 #else
05935 
05936     #define __txLocCurSet( _file, _line, _func ) \
05937         ( _txLoc::Cur.file = (_file), _txLoc::Cur.line = (_line), _txLoc::Cur.func = (_func) )
05938 
05939 #endif
05940 
05941 #define _txLocCurSet()     __txLocCurSet (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__)
05942 
05943 #define _txLocLvlSet(lvl)  { _txLoc::Cur.trace = (lvl); }
05944 
05945 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05946 
05947 #if defined ($0)
05948     #undef   $0
05949     #endif
05950 
05951 #if defined ($1)
05952     #undef   $1
05953     #endif
05954 
05955 #if defined ($2)
05956     #undef   $2
05957     #endif
05958 
05959 #if defined ($3)
05960     #undef   $3
05961     #endif
05962 
05963 #if defined ($4)
05964     #undef   $4
05965     #endif
05966 
05967 #if defined ($5)
05968     #undef   $5
05969     #endif
05970 
05971 #if defined ($6)
05972     #undef   $6
05973     #endif
05974 
05975 #if defined ($7)
05976     #undef   $7
05977     #endif
05978 
05979 #if defined ($8)
05980     #undef   $8
05981     #endif
05982 
05983 #if defined ($9)
05984     #undef   $9
05985     #endif
05986 
05987 #if defined ($)
05988     #undef   $
05989     #endif
05990 
05991 #if defined ($$)
05992     #undef   $$
05993     #endif
05994 
05995 //}
05996 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
05997 
05998 #if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
05999 
06000     #define _txEntry(lvl)  _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; { if (lvl) _txLocLvlSet (lvl);    $;          }
06001 
06002     #define  $           { _txLocCurSet(); if (_txLoc::Cur.trace <= _TX_ALLOW_TRACE+0) { TX_TRACE; } }
06003 
06004     #define  $$          { __txFuncEntry.restore();                                                  }
06005 
06006 #elif defined (_DEBUG)
06007 
06008     #define _txEntry(lvl)  _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; {                                 $;          }
06009 
06010     #define  $           { _txLocCurSet();                                                           }
06011 
06012     #define  $$          { __txFuncEntry.restore();                                                  }
06013 
06014 #else
06015 
06016     #define _txEntry(lvl)  ;
06017     #define  $             ;
06018     #define  $$            ;
06019 
06020 #endif
06021 
06022 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06023 
06024 #define      $0            _txEntry (0)  // (Log level unchanged)
06025 #define      $1            _txEntry (1)  // Regular functions
06026 #define      $2            _txEntry (2)  // Resvd
06027 #define      $3            _txEntry (3)  // Init/Cleanup
06028 #define      $4            _txEntry (4)  // Init/Cleanup, misc functions
06029 #define      $5            _txEntry (5)  // Error handling, entry points
06030 #define      $6            _txEntry (6)  // Error handling, main part
06031 #define      $7            _txEntry (7)  // Error handling, misc functions
06032 #define      $8            _txEntry (8)  // Canvas worker thread
06033 #define      $9            _txEntry (9)  // Resvd
06034 
06035 //}
06036 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06037 
06038 #endif // FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
06039 
06042 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06043 
06045 //}
06046 //=================================================================================================================
06047 
06048 //=================================================================================================================
06049 //{          Sweet critical section blocking: txAutoLock class
06050 //=================================================================================================================
06051 
06052 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06068 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06069 
06071 extern CRITICAL_SECTION _txCanvas_LockBackBuf;
06073 
06074 class txAutoLock
06075     {
06076     typedef txAutoLock this_t;
06077 
06078     public:
06079 
06080 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06103 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06104 
06105     explicit txAutoLock (CRITICAL_SECTION* cs, bool mandatory = true) :
06106         cs_ (cs)
06107         {
06108 $1      if (!cs_) return;
06109 
06110         if (mandatory) {$    EnterCriticalSection (cs_);                   }
06111         else           {$ TryEnterCriticalSection (cs_)? 0 : (cs_ = NULL); }
06112         }
06113 
06114 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06127 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06128 
06129     explicit txAutoLock (bool mandatory = true) :
06130         cs_ (NULL)
06131         {
06132 $1      new (this) txAutoLock (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf, mandatory);
06133         }
06134 
06135 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06137 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06138 
06139    ~txAutoLock()
06140         {
06141 $1      if (!cs_) return;
06142 $       LeaveCriticalSection (cs_); cs_ = NULL;
06143         }
06144 
06145 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06148 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06149 
06150     operator bool () const
06151         {
06152 $1      return (cs_ != NULL);
06153         }
06154 
06155 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06157 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06158 
06159 //  private:
06160     CRITICAL_SECTION* cs_;
06161 
06162 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06164 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06166 
06167     private:
06168             txAutoLock (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06169     this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06170 
06172 
06173     };
06174 
06175 //}
06176 //=================================================================================================================
06177 
06178 //=================================================================================================================
06179 //{          Dialogs: txDialog class
06181 //=================================================================================================================
06183 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06204 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06205 
06206 struct txDialog
06207     {
06208     typedef txDialog this_t;
06209 
06210 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06223 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06224 
06225     public:
06226     enum CONTROL
06227         {
06228         DIALOG    = (int) 0x00000000,            
06229         BUTTON    = (int) 0xFFFF0080,            
06230         EDIT      = (int) 0xFFFF0081,            
06231         STATIC    = (int) 0xFFFF0082,            
06232         LISTBOX   = (int) 0xFFFF0083,            
06233         SCROLLBAR = (int) 0xFFFF0084,            
06234         COMBOBOX  = (int) 0xFFFF0085,            
06235         END       = (int) 0x00000000             
06236         };
06237 
06238 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06255 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06256 
06257     public:
06258     struct Layout
06259         {                                        //-V802
06260         CONTROL     wndclass;                    
06261         const char* caption;                     
06262         WORD        id;                          
06263         short        x;                          
06264         short        y;                          
06265         short       sx;                          
06266         short       sy;                          
06267         DWORD       style;                       
06268 
06269         const char* font;                        
06270         WORD        fontsize;                    
06271         };
06272 
06273 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06281 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06282 
06283     public:
06284     txDialog();
06285 
06286 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06296 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06297 
06298     explicit txDialog (const Layout* layout);
06299 
06300 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06302 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06303 
06304     virtual ~txDialog() {};
06305 
06306 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06318 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06319 
06320     const Layout* setLayout (const Layout *layout);
06321 
06322 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06340 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06341 
06342     virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam);
06343 
06344 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06360 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06361 
06362     intptr_t dialogBox (const Layout* layout = NULL, size_t bufsize = 0);
06363 
06364 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06377 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06378 
06379     intptr_t dialogBox (WORD resource);
06380 
06381 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06383 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06384 
06385     private:
06386             txDialog   (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06387     this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
06388 
06389 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06391 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06392 
06393     protected:
06394     static intptr_t CALLBACK DialogProc_ (HWND wnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam);
06395 
06396 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06398 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06399 
06400     private:
06401     const Layout* layout_;
06402     };
06403 
06405 //}
06406 //=================================================================================================================
06407 
06408 //=================================================================================================================
06409 //{          Dialogs: Message Map macros
06411 //=================================================================================================================
06413 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06434 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06435 
06436 #define TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP()                                                                 \
06437     virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam) _tx_override \
06438         {                                                                                      \
06439         int _result = txDialog::dialogProc (_wnd, _msg, _wParam, _lParam); (void) _result;     \
06440                                                                                                \
06441         switch (_msg)                                                                          \
06442             {                                                                                  \
06443             case WM_NULL:
06444 
06445 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06464 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06465 
06466 #define TX_HANDLE( id )                                                                        \
06467             break;                                                                             \
06468             case (id):
06469 
06470 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06490 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06491 
06492 #define TX_COMMAND_MAP                                                                         \
06493             default: break;                                                                    \
06494             }                                                                                  \
06495                                                                                                \
06496         if (_msg == WM_COMMAND) switch (LOWORD (_wParam))                                      \
06497             {                                                                                  \
06498             case 0:
06499 
06500 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06519 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06520 
06521 #define TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP                                                                     \
06522             default: break;                                                                    \
06523             }                                                                                  \
06524                                                                                                \
06525         return FALSE;                                                                          \
06526         }
06527 
06529 //}
06530 //=================================================================================================================
06531 
06532 //=================================================================================================================
06533 //{          Dialogs: txDialog example: txInputBox()
06535 //=================================================================================================================
06537 //{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06557 //}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06558 
06559 const char* txInputBox (const char* text = NULL, const char* caption = NULL, const char* input = NULL) tx_nodiscard;
06560 
06561 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
06562 
06563 const char* txInputBox (const char* text, const char* caption, const char* input)
06564     {
06565     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06566     // Если не указаны параметры, приходится использовать хоть какие-то надписи.
06567     // txGetModuleFileName() -- имя EXE-файла, на случай, если кое-кто поленился задать название.
06568     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06569 
06570     if (!text)    text    = "Введите строку:";
06571     if (!caption) caption = txGetModuleFileName (false);
06572     if (!input)   input   = "";
06573 
06574     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06575     // Идентификаторы элементов диалога. Они требуются в GetDlgItemText().
06576     // Если диалог строится не вручную, а редактором ресурсов, то они задаются в нем автоматически.
06577     // У нас же тут -- хардкор стайл, к сожалению. Причина в том, что у разных сред программирования разные редакторы
06578     // ресурсов и системы сборки. Поэтому для независимости от них все будет строиться на этапе выполнения,
06579     // динамически. Вы еще гляньте, как это реализовано в txDialog::dialogBox() и функциях _tx_DLGTEMPLATE_()... О_о
06580     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06581 
06582     #define ID_TEXT_  101
06583     #define ID_INPUT_ 102
06584 
06585     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06586     // Задание макета (вида) диалога в виде массива структур.
06587     // С помощью особого порядка полей в структуре txDialog::Layout и констант из класса txDialog этот массив
06588     // становится похож на описание ресурса диалога в .rc-файле.
06589     // См. описание синтаксиса rc-файла в документации по Win32 (MSDN, http://msdn.com).
06590     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06591 
06592     txDialog::Layout layout[] =
06593 
06594     //----------------------+----------+-----------+-----------------+---------------------------------------------
06595     //     Тип элемента     | Имя      | Иденти-   |   Координаты    | Флаги элементов
06596     //     диалога          | элемента | фикатор   |-----------------| (см. описание элементов
06597     //                      |          | элемента  | X | Y |Шир.|Выс.| окон диалога в MSDN)
06598     //----------------------+----------+-----------+---+---+----+----+---------------------------------------------
06599     //                      |          |           |   |   |    |    |
06600         {{ txDialog::DIALOG,  caption,   0,           0,  0, 240,  85                                                    },
06601          { txDialog::STATIC,  text,      ID_TEXT_,   10, 10, 150,  40, SS_LEFT                                           },
06602          { txDialog::EDIT,    input,     ID_INPUT_,  10, 60, 220,  15, ES_LEFT | WS_BORDER | ES_AUTOHSCROLL | WS_TABSTOP },
06603          { txDialog::BUTTON,  "&OK",     IDOK,      180, 10,  50,  15, BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON                     | WS_TABSTOP },
06604          { txDialog::BUTTON,  "&Cancel", IDCANCEL,  180, 30,  50,  15, BS_PUSHBUTTON                        | WS_TABSTOP },
06605          { txDialog::END                                                                                                 }};
06606 
06607     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06608     // Класс диалога для InputBox. Внутренний, т.к. зачем ему быть внешним.
06609     // Нужен в основном для задания строки ввода (str) и оконной функции диалогового окна, требуемой Win32 (она
06610     // построена макросами TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP и другими). Можно не делать внутреннего класса, но тогда оконную
06611     // функцию придется писать в глобальной области видимости, и str объявлять глобально тоже (или передавать ее
06612     // адрес через DialogBoxParam и записывать его в класс во время обработки WM_INITDIALOG).
06613     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06614     struct inputDlg : txDialog
06615         {
06616         char str [1024];
06617 
06618         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06619 
06620         inputDlg() :
06621             str()
06622             {}
06623 
06624         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06625 
06626         TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP()    // Карта сообщений (на самом деле это начало оконной функции).  //-V2525
06627 
06628             TX_COMMAND_MAP        // Здесь обрабатываются WM_COMMAND (на самом деле это оператор switch).
06629 
06630                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06631                 // При нажатии кнопки OK копируем строку из поля ввода в нашу переменную str, т.к. после закрытия
06632                 // диалога строка ввода умрет и текст уже из нее получить.
06633                 // Этот макрос на самом деле превращается в case из оператора switch.
06634                 // _wnd -- это параметр оконной функции, см. определение макроса TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP().
06635                 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06636 
06637                 TX_HANDLE (IDOK) GetDlgItemText (_wnd, ID_INPUT_, str, sizeof (str) - 1);
06638 
06639         TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP        //-V2522
06640 
06641         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06642         // Конец внутреннего класса диалога
06643         //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06644         };
06645 
06646     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06647     // Убираем дефайны, чтобы потом не мешали.
06648     // От этого они получаются "локального действия", как будто у них была бы область видимости -- функция. На самом
06649     // деле это сделано вручную через #undef. Чтобы подчеркнуть их локальную природу, у них имена заканчиваются на _.
06650     // Такие дефайны потом не перекосячат весь код после того как, фактически, стали уже не нужны.
06651     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06652 
06653     #undef ID_TEXT_
06654     #undef ID_INPUT_
06655 
06656     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06657     // Это статический объект, потому что строка в нем должна жить после завершения функции.
06658     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06659 
06660     static inputDlg dlg;
06661 
06662     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06663     // Передаем layout и запускаем окно диалога
06664     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06665 
06666     dlg.dialogBox (layout);
06667 
06668     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06669     // Возвращаем адрес строки из статического объекта. Так можно делать, потому что статический объект не умрет
06670     // при выходе из функции и строка в нем, соответственно, тоже. Адрес нестатических переменных передавать
06671     // синтаксически можно, но ведет к серьезным ошибкам.
06672     //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06673 
06674     return dlg.str;
06675     }
06676 
06677 #endif // TX_COMPILED
06678 
06680 //}
06681 //=================================================================================================================
06682 
06683 //}
06684 //=================================================================================================================
06685 
06686 //=================================================================================================================
06687 //{          TXLIB IMPLEMENTATION
06688 //           Реализация функций библиотеки
06689 //=================================================================================================================
06691 
06692 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06693 //{          The Includes
06694 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
06695

06839 #define SYMOPT_OMAP_FIND_NEAREST                 0x00000020
06840 #define SYMOPT_LOAD_ANYTHING                     0x00000040

06843 #define SYMOPT_FAIL_CRITICAL_ERRORS              0x00000200
06844 #define SYMOPT_EXACT_SYMBOLS                     0x00000400
06845 #define SYMOPT_ALLOW_ABSOLUTE_SYMBOLS            0x00000800
06846 #define SYMOPT_IGNORE_NT_SYMPATH                 0x00001000
06847 #define SYMOPT_INCLUDE_32BIT_MODULES             0x00002000
06848 #define SYMOPT_PUBLICS_ONLY                      0x00004000
06849 #define SYMOPT_NO_PUBLICS                        0x00008000
06850 #define SYMOPT_AUTO_PUBLICS                      0x00010000
06851 #define SYMOPT_NO_IMAGE_SEARCH                   0x00020000

06853 #define SYMOPT_NO_PROMPTS                        0x00080000
06854 #define SYMOPT_ALLOW_ZERO_ADDRESS                0x01000000

06856 #define SYMOPT_FAVOR_COMPRESSED                  0x00800000
06857 #define SYMOPT_FLAT_DIRECTORY                    0x00400000
06858 #define SYMOPT_IGNORE_IMAGEDIR                   0x00200000

06867 #endif

06879 #endif

06887 #endif
06888

06898 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1       0x19930520  // '?msc' version magic, see ehdata.h
06899 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2       0x19930521  // '?msc' version magic
06900 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3       0x19930522  // '?msc' version magic
06901 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_PURE_MAGIC_NUMBER1  0x01994000  // '?msc' version magic
06902

06904 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_UNWIND                 0x21474343  // '!GCC'
06905 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_FORCED                 0x22474343  // '"GCC'
06906 
06907 #define EXCEPTION_CLR_FAILURE                    0xE0434f4D  // 'аCOM'
06908 
06909 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_BUILDER            0x0EEDFAE6  // Should never occur here
06910 #define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_DELPHI             0x0EEDFADE  // Should never occur here

06971 #undef  INTERFACE
06972 #define INTERFACE IShellLinkDataList
06973 
06974 DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (IShellLinkDataList, IUnknown)
06975     {
06976     // *** IUnknown methods ***
06977     STDMETHOD (QueryInterface)  (THIS_ REFIID iid, void** value)    _tx_override PURE;
06978     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, AddRef)   (THIS)                              _tx_override PURE;
06979     STDMETHOD_(ULONG, Release)  (THIS)                              _tx_override PURE;
06980 
06981     // *** IShellLinkDataList methods ***
06982     STDMETHOD (AddDataBlock)    (THIS_ void* dataBlock)             PURE;
06983     STDMETHOD (CopyDataBlock)   (THIS_ DWORD sig, void** dataBlock) PURE;
06984     STDMETHOD (RemoveDataBlock) (THIS_ DWORD sig)                   PURE;
06985     STDMETHOD (GetFlags)        (THIS_ DWORD* flags)                PURE;
06986     STDMETHOD (SetFlags)        (THIS_ DWORD  flags)                PURE;
06987 
06988     protected:
06989     virtual ~IShellLinkDataList();
06990     };

06992 const GUID IID_IShellLink         = {0x000214ee, 0x0000, 0x0000, {0xc0,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x46}};
06993 const GUID IID_IShellLinkDataList = {0x45e2b4ae, 0xb1c3, 0x11d0, {0xb9,0x2f,0x00,0xa0,0xc9,0x03,0x12,0xe1}};
06994 const GUID IID_IPersistFile       = {0x0000010b, 0x0000, 0x0000, {0xc0,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x46}};

06996 const GUID CLSID_SpVoice          = {0x96749377, 0x3391, 0x11d2, {0x9e,0xe3,0x00,0xc0,0x4f,0x79,0x73,0x96}};
06997 const GUID IID_ISpVoice           = {0x6c44df74, 0x72b9, 0x4992, {0xa1,0xec,0xef,0x99,0x6e,0x04,0x22,0xd4}};

07010     };

07020 struct PEB
07021     {
07022     BYTE  Reserved1[2];
07023     BYTE  BeingDebugged;
07024     BYTE  Reserved2[1];
07025     void* Reserved3[2];
07026     void* Ldr;
07027     RTL_USER_PROCESS_PARAMETERS* ProcessParameters;
07028     void* Reserved4[3];
07029     void* AtlThunkSListPtr;
07030     void* Reserved5;
07031     ULONG Reserved6;
07032     void* Reserved7;
07033     ULONG Reserved8;
07034     ULONG AtlThunkSListPtr32;
07035     void* Reserved9[45];
07036     BYTE  Reserved10[96];
07037     void* PostProcessInitRoutine;
07038     BYTE  Reserved11[128];
07039     void* Reserved12[1];
07040     ULONG SessionId;
07041     };
