07177     };
07178 
07179 typedef bool    (__stdcall *PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64)   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 baseAddress, void* buffer, DWORD size, DWORD* bytesRead);
07180 typedef void*   (__stdcall *PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64) (HANDLE process, DWORD64 baseAddress);
07181 typedef DWORD64 (__stdcall *PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64)       (HANDLE process, DWORD64 address);
07182 typedef DWORD64 (__stdcall *PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64)     (HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, ADDRESS64* address);
07183 
07184 typedef void (*unexpected_handler)();
07185 
07186 #pragma pack (push, 4)
07187 
07188 struct MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK
07189     {
07190     ULONG    ThreadId;
07191     HANDLE   ThreadHandle;
07192     CONTEXT  Context;
07193     ULONG    SizeOfContext;
07194     ULONG64  StackBase;
07195     ULONG64  StackEnd;
07196     };
07197 
07198 struct MINIDUMP_THREAD_EX_CALLBACK
07199     {
07200     ULONG    ThreadId;
07201     HANDLE   ThreadHandle;
07202     CONTEXT  Context;
07203     ULONG    SizeOfContext;
07204     ULONG64  StackBase;
07205     ULONG64  StackEnd;
07206     ULONG64  BackingStoreBase;
07207     ULONG64  BackingStoreEnd;
07208     };
07209 
07210 struct MINIDUMP_MODULE_CALLBACK
07211     {
07212     wchar_t* FullPath;
07213     ULONG64  BaseOfImage;
07214     ULONG    SizeOfImage;
07215     ULONG    CheckSum;
07216     ULONG    TimeDateStamp;
07217     VS_FIXEDFILEINFO VersionInfo;
07218     void*    CvRecord;
07219     ULONG    SizeOfCvRecord;
07220     PVOID    MiscRecord;
07221     ULONG    SizeOfMiscRecord;
07222     };
07223 
07224 struct MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_THREAD_CALLBACK
07225     {
07226     ULONG    ThreadId;
07227     };
07228 
07229 struct MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_MODULE_CALLBACK
07230     {
07231     ULONG64  BaseOfImage;
07232     };
07233 
07234 struct MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO
07235     {
07236     ULONG64  BaseAddress;
07237     ULONG64  AllocationBase;
07238     ULONG32  AllocationProtect;
07239     ULONG32  __alignment1;
07240     ULONG64  RegionSize;
07241     ULONG32  State;
07242     ULONG32  Protect;
07243     ULONG32  Type;
07244     ULONG32  __alignment2;
07245     };
07246 
07247 struct MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM
07248     {
07249     ULONG32  Type;
07250     ULONG    BufferSize;
07251     PVOID    Buffer;
07252     };
07253 
07254 struct MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM_INFORMATION
07255     {
07256     ULONG                 UserStreamCount;
07257     MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM* UserStreamArray;
07258     };
07259 
07260 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT
07261     {
07262     ULONG    ProcessId;
07263     HANDLE   ProcessHandle;
07264     ULONG    CallbackType;
07265 
07266     union  //-V2514
07267         {
07268         MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK         Thread;
07269         MINIDUMP_THREAD_EX_CALLBACK      ThreadEx;
07270         MINIDUMP_MODULE_CALLBACK         Module;
07271         MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_THREAD_CALLBACK IncludeThread;
07272         MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_MODULE_CALLBACK IncludeModule;
07273         };
07274     };
07275 
07276 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT
07277     {
07278     union  //-V2514
07279         {
07280         ULONG ModuleWriteFlags;
07281         ULONG ThreadWriteFlags;
07282         ULONG SecondaryFlags;
07283 
07284         struct
07285             {
07286             ULONG64  MemoryBase;
07287             ULONG    MemorySize;
07288             };
07289 
07290         struct
07291             {
07292             unsigned CheckCancel;
07293             unsigned Cancel;
07294             };
07295 
07296         HANDLE Handle;  //-V117
07297         };
07298 
07299     struct
07300         {
07301         MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO VmRegion;
07302         unsigned             Continue;
07303         };
07304 
07305     HRESULT Status;
07306     };
07307 
07308 struct MINIDUMP_EXCEPTION_INFORMATION
07309     {
07310     DWORD               ThreadId;
07311     EXCEPTION_POINTERS* ExceptionPointers;
07312     unsigned            ClientPointers;
07313     };
07314 
07315 typedef int (WINAPI* MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE) (void* param, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT* input, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT* output);
07316 
07317 struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INFORMATION
07318     {
07319     MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE CallbackRoutine;
07320     void*                     CallbackParam;
07321     };
07322 
07323 enum MINIDUMP_TYPE
07324     {
07325     MiniDumpNormal                         = 0x00000000,
07326     MiniDumpWithDataSegs                   = 0x00000001,
07327     MiniDumpWithFullMemory                 = 0x00000002,
07328     MiniDumpWithHandleData                 = 0x00000004,
07329     MiniDumpFilterMemory                   = 0x00000008,
07330     MiniDumpScanMemory                     = 0x00000010,
07331     MiniDumpWithUnloadedModules            = 0x00000020,
07332     MiniDumpWithIndirectlyReferencedMemory = 0x00000040,
07333     MiniDumpFilterModulePaths              = 0x00000080,
07334     MiniDumpWithProcessThreadData          = 0x00000100,
07335     MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory     = 0x00000200,
07336     MiniDumpWithoutOptionalData            = 0x00000400,
07337     MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo             = 0x00000800,
07338     MiniDumpWithThreadInfo                 = 0x00001000,
07339     MiniDumpWithCodeSegs                   = 0x00002000,
07340     MiniDumpWithoutAuxiliaryState          = 0x00004000,
07341     MiniDumpWithFullAuxiliaryState         = 0x00008000,
07342     MiniDumpWithPrivateWriteCopyMemory     = 0x00010000,
07343     MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory       = 0x00020000,
07344     MiniDumpWithTokenInformation           = 0x00040000
07345     };
07346 
07347 #ifndef CONTEXT_ALL
07348 #define CONTEXT_ALL              ( CONTEXT_CONTROL | CONTEXT_INTEGER | CONTEXT_SEGMENTS | CONTEXT_FLOATING_POINT | CONTEXT_DEBUG_REGISTERS )
07349 #endif
07350 
07351 #pragma pack (pop)
07352 
07353 } // namespace Win32
07354 
07355 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07356 
07357 #define FOREGROUND_BLACK         ( 0                                                         )
07358 #define FOREGROUND_CYAN          ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_GREEN                  )
07359 #define FOREGROUND_MAGENTA       ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_RED                    )
07360 #define FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW    ( FOREGROUND_GREEN      | FOREGROUND_RED                    )
07361 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY     ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED )
07362 #define FOREGROUND_DARKGRAY      (                         FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07363 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTBLUE     ( FOREGROUND_BLUE       | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07364 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGREEN    ( FOREGROUND_GREEN      | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07365 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTCYAN     ( FOREGROUND_CYAN       | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07366 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTRED      ( FOREGROUND_RED        | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07367 #define FOREGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA  ( FOREGROUND_MAGENTA    | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07368 #define FOREGROUND_YELLOW        ( FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07369 #define FOREGROUND_WHITE         ( FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY  | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07370 
07371 #define BACKGROUND_BLACK         ( 0                                                         )
07372 #define BACKGROUND_CYAN          ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_GREEN                  )
07373 #define BACKGROUND_MAGENTA       ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_RED                    )
07374 #define BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW    ( BACKGROUND_GREEN      | BACKGROUND_RED                    )
07375 #define BACKGROUND_GRAY          ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED )
07376 #define BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY      (                         BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07377 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTBLUE     ( BACKGROUND_BLUE       | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07378 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTGREEN    ( BACKGROUND_GREEN      | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07379 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTCYAN     ( BACKGROUND_CYAN       | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07380 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTRED      ( BACKGROUND_RED        | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07381 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA  ( BACKGROUND_MAGENTA    | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07382 #define BACKGROUND_LIGHTYELLOW   ( BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07383 #define BACKGROUND_WHITE         ( BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY   | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY              )
07384 
07385 //}
07386 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07387 
07388 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07389 //{ There are copies of MSVC compiler built-in predefined definitions, which are wrong in 64-bit mode.
07390 //  So we have to override them. See: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39113168
07391 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07392 
07393 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07394 
07395 #if defined (_MSC_VER)
07396                                                     //  MS ABI C++ Exception Layout
07397 namespace Win32 {                                   //  ---------------------------
07398                                                     //
07399 #pragma pack (push, 4)                              //   EXCEPTION_RECORD:
07400                                                     //  +==================================================+
07401 struct ThrowInfo                                    //  |...                                               |
07402     {                                               //  |NumberParameters:        3, 4 or more             |
07403     __int32 attributes;                             //  |ExceptionInformation[0]: MS signature 0x19930520  |
07404     __int32 pmfnUnwind;                             //  |ExceptionInformation[1]: object* thrown           |
07405     __int32 pForwardCompat;                         //  |ExceptionInformation[2]: ThrowInfo* --------------+---+
07406     __int32 pCatchableTypeArray;                    //  |ExceptionInformation[3]: ImageBase (if params > 3)|   |
07407     };                                              //  +==================================================+   |
07408                                                     //                                                         |
07409 struct CatchableTypeArray                           //        ThrowInfo:                                       |
07410     {                                               //        +======================================+ <-------+
07411     __int32 nCatchableTypes;                        //        |   ...                                |
07412     __int32 arrayOfCatchableTypes[];                //  +-----+-- pCatchableTypeArray (ptr/RVA)      |
07413     };                                              //  |     +======================================+
07414                                                     //  |
07415 struct CatchableType                                //  |     CatchableTypeArray:
07416     {                                               //  +---> +======================================+
07417     __int32 properties;                             //        |   ...                                |
07418     __int32 pType;                                  //  +-----+-- arrayOfCatchableTypes[0] (ptr/RVA) |
07419     __int32 thisDisplacement[3]; // struct _PMD     //  |     +======================================+
07420     __int32 sizeOrOffset;                           //  |
07421     __int32 copyFunction;                           //  |     CatchableType:
07422     };                                              //  +---> +====================+
07423                                                     //        | ...                |        std::type_info:
07424 #pragma pack (pop)                                  //        | pType (ptr/RVA) ---+------> +==================+
07425                                                     //        | ...                |        |type_info data    |
07426 } // namespace Win32                                //        +====================+        |...               |
07427                                                     //                                      +==================+
07428 #endif
07429 
07430 // Similar to __CxxDetectRethrow(), see C:\Bin\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\crt\src\crtsrc\vcruntime\frame.cpp:
07431 
07432 #define _TX_MSC__CXX_DETECT_RETHROW( exc )                                     \
07433     (                                                                          \
07434     (exc)                                          &&                          \
07435     (exc) -> ExceptionCode    == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC &&                          \
07436     (exc) -> NumberParameters >= 3                 &&                          \
07437                                                                                \
07438     ((exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1 ||  \
07439      (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2 ||  \
07440      (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3) && \
07441                                                                                \
07442     (exc) -> ExceptionInformation[2] == 0                                      \
07443     )
07444 
07445 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07446 
07447 //}
07448 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07449 
07450 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07451 //{ The corresponding structures for GCC
07452 //
07453 //  From: http://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/blob/master/libstdc%2B%2B-v3/libsupc%2B%2B/unwind-cxx.h
07454 //  See:  http://mentorembedded.github.io/cxx-abi/abi-eh.html#cxx-abi
07455 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07456 
07457 #if defined (_GCC_VER)
07458 
07459 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07460 
07461                                                     // GCC ABI C++ Exception layout. A/B are ExceptionInformation[0].
07462 namespace ABI {                                     // --------------------------------------------------------------
07463                                                     //
07464 struct __cxa_exception                              // Case A: "_Unwind_Exception* A" is undependent exception:
07465     {                                               // --------------------------------------------------------
07466     union {                                         //
07467         struct                                      //           __cxa_exception:           std::type_info:
07468             {                                       //       -*--+====================+     +==================+
07469             ::std::type_info* exceptionType;        //        ^  |exceptionType* -----+---->|type_info data    |
07470             void (*exceptionDestructor)(void*);     //        |  |...                 |     |...               |
07471             };                                      //       -1  |                    |     +==================+
07472         struct                                      //        |  |                    |
07473             {                                       // A >----|--+--------------------+
07474             __cxa_exception*  primaryException;     //     |  |  |unwindHeader        |
07475             void (*padding)();                      //    +1  |  |                    |
07476             };                                      //     |  |  |                    |
07477         };                                          //     V  |  |                    |
07478                                                     //    -*---  +====================+
07479     std::unexpected_handler   unexpectedHandler;    //           |object              |
07480     std::terminate_handler    terminateHandler;     //           +--------------------+
07481                                                     //
07482     __cxa_exception*          nextException;        // Case B: "_Unwind_Exception* B" is dependent exception
07483     int                       handlerCount;         // (unwindHeader.exception_class & 1 != 0):
07484     int                       handlerSwitchValue;   // -----------------------------------------------------
07485     const unsigned char*      actionRecord;         //
07486     const unsigned char*      languageSpecificData; //           __cxa_exception:               __cxa_exception:
07487     void*                     catchTemp;            //       -*--+====================+     -*--+=================+
07488     void*                     adjustedPtr;          //        ^  |primaryException* --+--    ^  |exceptionType*   |
07489                                                     //        |  |...                 |  \   |  |...              |
07490     _Unwind_Exception         unwindHeader;         //       -1  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07491     };                                              //        |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07492                                                     // B >----|--+--------------------+  |  -1  +-----------------+
07493 struct __cxa_eh_globals                             //     |  |  |unwindHeader        |  |   |  |unwindHeader     |
07494     {                                               //    +1  |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07495     __cxa_exception* caughtExceptions;              //     |  |  |                    |  |   |  |                 |
07496     unsigned int     uncaughtExceptions;            //     V  |  |                    |  \   |  |                 |
07497     };                                              //    -*---  +====================+   -->*--+=================+
07498                                                     //           |...                 |         |object           |
07499 } // namespace ABI                                  //           .                    .         |                 |
07500                                                     //                                          +-----------------+
07501 
07502 extern "C" ABI::__cxa_eh_globals* __cxa_get_globals();
07503 
07504 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07505 
07506 #endif
07507 
07508 //}
07509 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07510 
07511 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07512 //{ Hand-made IAT.
07513 //  Some IDEs don't link with these libs by default in console projects, so do sunrise by hand. :(
07514 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07515 
07516 // Hand-made DLLIMPORT helpers
07517 
07518 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT(     lib, retval, name, params ) \
07519      retval (WINAPI* name) params = (retval (WINAPI*) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, true)
07520 
07521 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT( lib, retval, name, params ) \
07522      retval (WINAPI* name) params = (retval (WINAPI*) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, false)
07523 
07524 #define _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT( lib, retval, name, params ) \
07525      retval (      * name) params = (retval (      *) params) _txDllImport (lib ".dll", #name, false)
07526 
07527 typedef void (*_tx_FARPROC)();
07528 
07529 _tx_FARPROC _txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required = true);
07530 
07531 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07532 
07533 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07534 
07535 namespace Win32 {
07536

07640 
07641 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("NTDLL",    char*,    wine_get_version,              (void));
07642 _TX_DLLIMPORT     ("NTDLL",    NTSTATUS, NtQueryInformationProcess,     (HANDLE process, int infoClass,
07643                                                                          void* processInfo, unsigned long szProcessInfo, unsigned long* szReturnInfo));
07644 
07645 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   void,     exit,                          (int retcode));
07646 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   void,     _cexit,                        (void));
07647 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unsigned, _fpreset,                      (void));
07648 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unsigned, _controlfp,                    (unsigned control, unsigned mask));
07649 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   uintptr_t,_beginthread,                  (void (__cdecl* start_address) (void*), unsigned stack_size, void* arglist));
07650 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   uintptr_t,_beginthreadex,                (void* security, unsigned stack_size, unsigned (__stdcall* start_address) (void*),
07651                                                                          void *arglist, unsigned init_flag, unsigned* thread_addr));
07652 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   char*,    __unDName,                     (char* outStr, const char* mangledName, int outStrLen,
07653                                                                          void* (*mallocFunc) (size_t size), void (*freeFunc) (void *pointer),
07654                                                                          unsigned short flags));
07655 _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT ("MSVCRT",   unexpected_handler, set_unexpected,      (unexpected_handler handler));
07656 
07657 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("OpenGL32", HDC,         wglGetCurrentDC,            (void));
07658 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("OpenGL32", unsigned,    glGetError,                 (void));
07659 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("Glu32",    const char*, gluErrorString,             (unsigned error));
07660 
07661 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     MiniDumpWriteDump,             (HANDLE process, DWORD processId, HANDLE file, MINIDUMP_TYPE dumpType,
07662                                                                          MINIDUMP_EXCEPTION_INFORMATION*   exceptionParam,
07663                                                                          MINIDUMP_USER_STREAM_INFORMATION* userStreamParam,
07664                                                                          MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INFORMATION*    callbackParam));
07665 
07666 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", DWORD,    SymSetOptions,                 (DWORD options));
07667 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymInitialize,                 (HANDLE process, const char userSearchPath[], bool invadeProcess));
07668 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymFromAddr,                   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD64* offset, SYMBOL_INFO*     symbol));
07669 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymGetLineFromAddr64,          (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD*   offset, IMAGEHLP_LINE64* line));
07670 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", DWORD64,  SymGetModuleBase64,            (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr));
07671 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     SymCleanup,                    (HANDLE process));
07672 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", void*,    SymFunctionTableAccess64,      (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addrBase));
07673 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("DbgHelp*", bool,     StackWalk64,                   (DWORD arch, HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, STACKFRAME64* frame, void* ctxRecord,
07674                                                                          PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64   readMemoryFunc,
07675                                                                          PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64 tableAccessFunc,
07676                                                                          PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64       getModuleBaseFunc,
07677                                                                          PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64     translateAddressFunc));
07678 namespace MinGW {
07679 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", DWORD,    SymSetOptions,                 (DWORD options));
07680 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymInitialize,                 (HANDLE process, const char userSearchPath[], bool invadeProcess));
07681 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymFromAddr,                   (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD64* offset, SYMBOL_INFO*     symbol));
07682 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymGetLineFromAddr64,          (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr, DWORD*   offset, IMAGEHLP_LINE64* line));
07683 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", DWORD64,  SymGetModuleBase64,            (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addr));
07684 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     SymCleanup,                    (HANDLE process));
07685 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", void*,    SymFunctionTableAccess64,      (HANDLE process, DWORD64 addrBase));
07686 _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT ("MgwHelp*", bool,     StackWalk64,                   (DWORD arch, HANDLE process, HANDLE thread, STACKFRAME64* frame, void* ctxRecord,
07687                                                                          PREAD_PROCESS_MEMORY_ROUTINE64   readMemoryFunc,
07688                                                                          PFUNCTION_TABLE_ACCESS_ROUTINE64 tableAccessFunc,
07689                                                                          PGET_MODULE_BASE_ROUTINE64       getModuleBaseFunc,
07690                                                                          PTRANSLATE_ADDRESS_ROUTINE64     translateAddressFunc));
07691 } // namespace MinGW
07692 } // namespace Win32
07693 
07694 #endif // TX_COMPILED
07695 
07696 //}
07697 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07698 
07700 //}

07846                                               const char msg[] = NULL, ...) tx_printfy (5);

07860 #endif
07861 
07862 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07863 // There are macros for __FILE__ and __LINE__ to work properly.
07864 
07865 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
07866 
07867     #define  _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond )       ( !(cond) &&                                          \
07868                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) && \
07869                                                      (assert (cond), true) )
07870 
07871     #define  _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()             ( !txOK() &&                                          \
07872                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) && \
07873                                                      (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования не создано или не в порядке."), 1) )
07874 
07875     #define  _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc )              ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) &&                       \
07876                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) && \
07877                                                      (TX_ERROR ("Параметр \"%s\" неверен. Возможно, этот холст не создан, " \
07878                                                                 "или уже уничтожен, или не загрузилась картинка.", #dc), 1) )
07879     #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc)         ( (!(dc) &&                                           \
07880                                                      _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) || _TX_HDC_FAILED (dc) )
07881 
07882 #else
07883     #define  _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond )       ( !(cond) &&                                          \
07884                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) )
07885 
07886     #define  _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()             ( !txOK() &&                                          \
07887                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07888 
07889     #define  _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc )              ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) &&                       \
07890                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07891 
07892     #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc)         ( !(dc) &&                                            \
07893                                                      (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA,  0), 1) )
07894 #endif
07895 
07896 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07897 // Take action in debug configuration only.
07898 // Definition ({ expr; }) would be better, but MSVC rejects it. So sad. :'(
07899 
07900 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
07901     #define  _TX_ON_DEBUG( code )              { code; }
07902 #else
07903     #define  _TX_ON_DEBUG( code )              ;
07904 #endif
07905 
07906 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07907 // Invokes an error without location information. "$$" restores TX-related call location context
07908 
07909 #define _TX_UNEXPECTED( ... )                  $$ _txError (NULL, 0, NULL, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
07910 
07911 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07912 // Safe call of a function via its pointer
07913 
07914 #define _TX_CALL(  func, param )               ( (func)? ((func) param) :       0 )
07915 #define _TX_CALLv( func, param )               ( (func)? ((func) param) : (void)0 )
07916 
07917 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07918 // This is a macro because cond is an expression and is not always a function. Lack of lambdas in pre-C++0x.
07919 
07920 #define _txWaitFor( cond, time )               { for (DWORD _t = GetTickCount() + (time); \
07921                                                       !(cond) && GetTickCount() < _t;     \
07922                                                       Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval)) ;  \
07923                                                  if  (!(cond))                            \
07924                                                       _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Timeout: " #cond "."); }
07925 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07926 // Detouring in case of SEH mechanism
07927 
07928 #define _txSetJmp()                            ( setjmp (_txDumpExceptionObjJmp) == 0 )
07929 
07930 #define _txClearJmp()                          { *(unsigned long long*) _txDumpExceptionObjJmp = 0; }
07931 
07932 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07933 // IN and OUT are defined in WinDef.h to support Microsoft SAL. Remove them because they are often confused with user's code.
07934 
07935 #if defined (IN)
07936     #undef  IN
07937 #endif
07938 
07939 #if defined (IN)
07940     #undef  OUT
07941 #endif
07942 
07944 //}
07945 //=================================================================================================================
07946 
07947 //=================================================================================================================
07948 //{          Internal global data
07950 //
07951 //           Данные не упакованы в структуру или класс, для того, чтобы это сделали Вы сами :)
07952 //
07953 //           Если вы пишете свою библиотеку и используете TXLib.h как пример, не следуйте ему и не делайте так же.
07954 //           Здесь это сделано только в образовательных целях.
07955 //
07956 //           Будьте практичнее, сделайте структуру и глобальную функцию для доступа к ней, или класс.
07957 //=================================================================================================================
07959 
07960 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
07961 
07962 const int                      _TX_IDM_ABOUT               = 40000,      // Идентификаторы системного меню окна
07963                                _TX_IDM_CONSOLE             = 40001,
07964                                _TX_WM_CREATEWND            = 0x7FF0,     // Сообщения для создания/уничтожения
07965                                _TX_WM_DESTROYWND           = 0x7FF1;     // окон в потоке Canvas
07966 
07967 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
07968 
07969 int                            _txInitialized              = _TX_NOINIT || _txInitialize();
07970 
07971 volatile unsigned              _txCanaryFirst              = 0x776F656D; // A very system value
07972 
07973 volatile unsigned              _txMainThreadId             = 0;          // ID потока, где выполняется main()
07974 volatile HANDLE                _txMainThread               = NULL;       // Дексриптор этого потока
07975 
07976 volatile unsigned              _txCanvas_ThreadId          = 0;          // ID потока, владеющего окном холста TXLib
07977 volatile HANDLE                _txCanvas_Thread            = NULL;       // Дексриптор этого потока
07978 volatile HWND                  _txCanvas_Window            = NULL;       // Дескриптор окна холста TXLib
07979 
07980 HDC                            _txCanvas_BackBuf[2]        = {NULL,      // [0] Main TXLib in-memory DC, where user's pictures lies
07981                                                               NULL};     // [1] Image ready for auto-refresh, see txCanvas_OnPAINT()
07982 
07983 RGBQUAD*                       _txCanvas_Pixels            = NULL;       // Memory buffer of _txCanvas_BackBuf[0]
07984 
07985 HBITMAP                        _txStockBitmap              = NULL;       // Equivalent of GetStockObject (BITMAP),
07986                                                                          // see https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20100416-00/?p=14313
07987 
07988 CRITICAL_SECTION               _txCanvas_LockBackBuf       = {0,-1};     // Prevent simultaneous access to back buffer, see txLock()
07989 
07990 UINT_PTR                       _txCanvas_RefreshTimer      = 1;          // Timer ID to redraw TXLib window
07991 volatile int                   _txCanvas_RefreshLock       = 0;          // Blocks auto on-timer canvas update, see txBegin/txEnd
07992 
07993 ::std::vector<HDC>*            _txCanvas_UserDCs           = NULL;       // List of DCs allocated, for auto-free
07994 
07995 volatile bool                  _txConsole_IsBlinking       = true;       // To blink or not to blink, that is the question.
07996 
07997 bool                           _txConsole                  = false;      // Only first TXLib module in app can own the console
07998 bool                           _txMain                     = false;      // First TXLib wnd opened (closing it terminates program)
07999 bool                           _txIsDll                    = false;      // TXLib module is in DLL
08000 volatile bool                  _txRunning                  = false;      // main() is still running
08001 volatile bool                  _txExit                     = false;      // exit() is active
08002 
08003 volatile POINT                 _txMousePos                 = {-1,-1};    // Ask Captn Obviouos about it. See txCanvas_OnMOUSE()
08004 volatile unsigned              _txMouseButtons             = 0;
08005 
08006 volatile WNDPROC               _txAltWndProc               = NULL;       // Альтернативная оконная функция. См. txSetWindowsHook().
08007 
08008 _tx_thread _txLoc              _txLoc::Cur                 = {};         // Execution point tracking and trace state, see "$" macro
08009 
08010 volatile int                   _txErrors                   = 0;          // TX_ERROR calls sequental number
08011 volatile int                   _txOGLError                 = 0;          // Last OpenGL error when using tx_glGetError()
08012 volatile long                  _txSENumber                 = 0;          // SEH exceptions sequental number
08013 volatile long                  _txSEFatalNumber            = 0;          // SEH fatal exceptions sequental number
08014 char                           _txDumpSE [_TX_BUFSIZE]     = "";         // SEH dump data area
08015 char                           _txTraceSE[_TX_HUGEBUFSIZE] = "";         // Stack trace data area
08016 
08017 LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER   _txPrevUEFilter             = NULL;       // Previous UnhandledExceptionFilter
08018 
08019 jmp_buf                        _txDumpExceptionObjJmp      = {};         // Hook for _txDumpExceptionObj
08020 
08021 const volatile uintptr_t       _txForceImport[]            = { (uintptr_t) ::TerminateProcess,              (uintptr_t) ::ExitProcess,
08022                                                                (uintptr_t) ::FatalExit,                     (uintptr_t) ::FatalAppExitA,
08023                                                                (uintptr_t) ::exit,                          (uintptr_t) Win32::_controlfp,
08024                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::Polyline,                 (uintptr_t) Win32::PolyBezier,
08025                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::RoundRect,                (uintptr_t) Win32::RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler,
08026                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::PlgBlt,                   (uintptr_t) Win32::RtlCaptureStackBackTrace,
08027                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymInitialize,            (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymInitialize,
08028                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymSetOptions,            (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymSetOptions,
08029                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetLineFromAddr64,     (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetLineFromAddr64,
08030                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFromAddr,              (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFromAddr,
08031                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymCleanup,               (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymCleanup,
08032                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetModuleBase64,       (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetModuleBase64,
08033                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFunctionTableAccess64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFunctionTableAccess64,
08034                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::StackWalk64,              (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::StackWalk64,
08035                                                                (uintptr_t) Win32::StrStrIA,                 (uintptr_t) Win32::Wow64GetThreadContext };
08036 
08037 volatile unsigned              _txCanaryLast               = 0x5E2E2E5E; // Another very system value
08038 
08039 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08040 
08041 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08042 
08043 extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryFirst;
08044 extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryLast;
08045 extern volatile HWND     _txCanvas_Window;
08046 extern volatile unsigned _txCanvas_ThreadId;
08047 extern          HDC      _txCanvas_BackBuf[2];
08048 extern          RGBQUAD* _txCanvas_Pixels;
08049 extern volatile int      _txCanvas_RefreshLock;
08050 extern volatile WNDPROC  _txAltWndProc;
08051 extern volatile bool     _txExit;
08052 extern volatile int      _txOGLError;
08053 
08055 //}
08056 //=================================================================================================================
08057 
08058 //=================================================================================================================
08059 //{          TXLib engine init/check/cleanup
08061 //=================================================================================================================
08063 
08064 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08065 //{          Early initialization
08066 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08067 
08068 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08069 
08070 int _txInitialize()
08071     {
08072     if (_txInitialized) return 1;
08073     _txInitialized = 1;
08074 
08075     #if defined (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK) && defined (_MSC_VER)  // See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w2fhc9a3%28v=vs.90%29.aspx
08076     _CrtSetBreakAlloc (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK);                 // and http://support.microsoft.com/ru-ru/kb/151585
08077     #endif
08078 
08079     #if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
08080     _txLocLvlSet (1);
08081     #endif
08082 
08083     _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
08084                   OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - The Dumb Artist Library, " _TX_AUTHOR ": \"" __FILE__ "\" "
08085                                      "compiled " __DATE__ " " __TIME__ ", " _TX_BUILDMODE " mode, module: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
08086                   OutputDebugString ("\n"));
08087 
08088     _txMainThreadId = GetCurrentThreadId();
08089     _txMainThread   = OpenThread (THREAD_ALL_ACCESS, false, _txMainThreadId);
08090 
08091 $3  _txIsDll = _txInDll();
08092 
08093 $   if (!_txIsDll)
08094         {
08095 $       _txConsole = ! FindAtom ("_txConsole");
08096 $       (void)          AddAtom ("_txConsole");  //-V530
08097         }
08098 
08099 $   if (_txConsole)
08100         {
08101 $       _txCheckSourceCP (_TX_CODEPAGE, true);
08102 
08103 $       unsigned long stackSize = _TX_STACKSIZE;
08104 $       _TX_CALL (Win32::SetThreadStackGuarantee, (&stackSize));
08105 
08106 $       _txOnSignal();
08107 
08108 $       if (!*_txLogName)
08109             {$ _tx_snprintf_s (_txLogName, sizeof (_txLogName) - 1, "%s.log", txGetModuleFileName()); }
08110 
08111 $       if (!_txIsDll)
08112             {
08113 $           _TX_CALL  (Win32::AddVectoredExceptionHandler, (1, (PVECTORED_EXCEPTION_HANDLER)  _txVectoredExceptionHandler));
08114 $           _txPrevUEFilter = SetUnhandledExceptionFilter  (   (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter);
08115             }
08116 
08117 $       ::std::set_terminate             (_txOnTerminate);
08118 $       ::std::set_new_handler           (_txOnNewHandlerAnsi);
08119 $       _TX_CALL (Win32::set_unexpected, (_txOnUnexpected));
08120 
08121         #if defined (_CLANG_VER) && !defined (_MSC_VER)
08122 $       ::std::__libcpp_debug_function = _txLibCppDebugFunction;
08123         #endif
08124 
08125 $       SetConsoleCtrlHandler (_txOnConsoleCtrlEvent, true);
08126 
08127 $       SetErrorMode (SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS | SEM_NOGPFAULTERRORBOX);
08128 
08129         #if defined (_MSC_VER)
08130 
08131 $       _set_printf_count_output (1);
08132 
08133 $       _set_new_handler (_txOnNewHandler);
08134 $       _set_new_mode (1);
08135 
08136         #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
08137 
08138 $       _CrtSetDbgFlag (_CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF | _CRTDBG_CHECK_ALWAYS_DF | _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF);
08139 $       _CrtSetAllocHook (_txOnAllocHook);
08140 
08141 $       unsigned mode = _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE;
08142 $       if (_CrtSetReportHook2 (_CRT_RPTHOOK_INSTALL, (_CRT_REPORT_HOOK) _txOnErrorReport) > 0) mode = 0;
08143 
08144 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_WARN,   _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode);
08145 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ERROR,  _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
08146 $       _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
08147 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_WARN,   _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08148 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ERROR,  _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08149 $       _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
08150 
08151         #endif
08152 
08153 $       _set_abort_behavior (_WRITE_ABORT_MSG, _WRITE_ABORT_MSG);
08154 $       _set_abort_behavior (0,                _CALL_REPORTFAULT);
08155 
08156 $       _RTC_SetErrorFunc              (_txOnRTCFailure);
08157 $       _set_purecall_handler          (_txOnPureCall);
08158 $       _set_invalid_parameter_handler (_txOnInvalidParam);
08159 
08160         #endif
08161 
08162         #if defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__)
08163 $       ::std::set_constraint_handler_s (_txOnSecurityErrorAnsi);
08164         #endif
08165 
08166         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__) && defined (_GCC_VER) && (_GCC_VER >= 530) && !defined (i386)
08167 $       __setusermatherr (_txOnMatherr);
08168         #endif
08169 
08170         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08171 $       _set_error_mode (_OUT_TO_MSGBOX | _OUT_TO_STDERR);
08172         #endif
08173 
08174 $       HWND console = _txConsole_Attach();
08175 $       SetWindowTextA (console, txGetModuleFileName (false));
08176         }
08177 
08178 $   InitializeCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf);
08179 
08180 $   _txSetProcAddress ("ExitProcess",                 (uintptr_t) _txOnExitProcess,                 "KERNEL32.DLL");
08181 $   _txSetProcAddress ("TerminateProcess",            (uintptr_t) _txOnTerminateProcess,            "KERNEL32.DLL");
08182 $   _txSetProcAddress ("FatalExit",                   (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalExit,                   "KERNEL32.DLL");
08183 $   _txSetProcAddress ("FatalAppExitA",               (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalAppExitA,               "KERNEL32.DLL");
08184 $   _txSetProcAddress ("UnhandledExceptionFilter",    (uintptr_t) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter,      "KERNEL32.DLL", true);  //-V601
08185 $   _txSetProcAddress ("SetUnhandledExceptionFilter", (uintptr_t) _txOnSetUnhandledExceptionFilter, "KERNEL32.DLL");
08186 $   _txSetProcAddress ("exit",                        (uintptr_t) _txOnExit);
08187 $   _txSetProcAddress ("_cexit",                      (uintptr_t) _txOnCExit);
08188 
08189 $   atexit (_txCleanup);
08190 
08191 $   if (_txConsole)
08192         {
08193 $       txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
08194 
08195 $       tx_fpreset();
08196 
08197 $       srand ((unsigned) time (NULL));  //-V202
08198 
08199 $       SetLastError (0);
08200 $       errno = 0;
08201 
08202         #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08203 $       _doserrno = 0;
08204         #endif
08205         }
08206 
08207 $   HDC dc = Win32::CreateCompatibleDC (NULL); dc asserted;
08208 $   _txStockBitmap = (HBITMAP) Win32::SelectObject (dc, Win32::CreateCompatibleBitmap (dc, 1, 1)); _txStockBitmap asserted;
08209 $   Win32::DeleteObject (Win32::SelectObject (dc, _txStockBitmap)) asserted;
08210 $   Win32::DeleteDC (dc) asserted;
08211 
08212 $   return 1;
08213     }
08214 
08215 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08216 
08217 bool _txCheckSourceCP (int needCP /*= _TX_CODEPAGE*/, bool verbose /*= true*/)
08218     {
08219 $3  const char* sCodePage = NULL;
08220 $   int codePage = 0;
08221 
08222 $   switch (((unsigned const char*) "А") [0])
08223         {
08224         case 192: {$ codePage =  1251; sCodePage = "1251.";          break; }
08225         case 208: {$ codePage = 65001; sCodePage = "UTF-8.";         break; }
08226         case 128: {$ codePage =   866; sCodePage = "866.";           break; }
08227         case 225: {$ codePage = 20866; sCodePage = "KOI-8, waaat?!"; break; }
08228         default:  {$ codePage =    -1; sCodePage = "(Unknown)";      break; }
08229         }
08230 
08231 $   if (codePage != needCP && verbose)
08232         {
08233 $       *_txTraceSE = ' ';  // No stack trace please
08234 
08235 $       _TX_UNEXPECTED ("\v\t" "\n\n" "WARNING: CHECK TXLib.h file CODEPAGE. Maybe it is %s It should be %d.\n\n"
08236                         "This is NOT an error of TXLib itself. Please note:\n\n"
08237                         "Do NOT copy-and-paste TXLib.h file contents into a new file and them save it inside your "
08238                         "IDE or editor. This can change original TXLib codepage (%d) to another one. Instead, DO "
08239                         "use copy / move / cut-and-paste operations in Windows Explorer (Far Manager etc) only. "
08240                         "Or, when you see TXLib.h being opened in browser, use 'Save as...' (Ctrl+S) command.\n\n"
08241                         "Now you should re-download TXLib.h file from the http://txlib.ru site.\n\n"
08242                         "You can continue, but Russian messages and symbols may appear unreadable.",
08243                         sCodePage, needCP, needCP);
08244         }
08245 
08246 $   return (codePage == needCP);
08247     }
08248 
08249 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08250 
08251 _tx_FARPROC _txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required /*= true*/)
08252     {
08253     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (dllFileName && *dllFileName)) return NULL;
08254     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (funcName    && *funcName))    return NULL;
08255 
08256     static char dllPaths [2][MAX_PATH] = {"", ""};
08257 
08258     if (!*dllPaths[0])
08259         {
08260         const char dllDir[]  = "\\Windows\\";
08261 
08262         // dllPaths[0] is relative to the TX Setup directory stored in the Registry
08263 
08264         char* path = dllPaths[0];
08265 
08266         txRegQuery ("HKCU\\Software\\TX Library", "ProductDir", path, MAX_PATH);
08267         strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
08268 
08269         // dllPaths[1] is relative to TXib.h file used in compilation
08270 
08271         path = dllPaths[1];
08272 
08273         if (strchr (__FILE__, ':'))
08274             {
08275             strncpy_s (path, MAX_PATH, __FILE__, sizeof (__FILE__) - 1);
08276             }
08277         else
08278             {
08279             GetCurrentDirectory (MAX_PATH, path);
08280             strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, "\\" __FILE__, sizeof ("\\" __FILE__) - 1);
08281             }
08282 
08283         if (char* dir = strrchr (path, '\\')) *dir = 0;
08284 
08285         strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
08286         }
08287 
08288     char dllName[MAX_PATH] = "", dllArch[MAX_PATH] = "";
08289     const char* arch = (dllFileName? strchr (dllFileName, '*') : NULL);  //-V547
08290 
08291     if (arch)
08292         {
08293         assert (arch >= dllFileName);  //-V547
08294 
08295         strncpy_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
08296         strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), arch+1, sizeof (dllName) - 1 - strlen (dllName));
08297 
08298         strncpy_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
08299         strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), sizeof (void*) == 8? "64" : "32", 3);
08300         strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), arch+1, sizeof (dllArch) - 1 - strlen (dllArch));
08301         }
08302     else if (dllFileName)  //-V547 //-V2516
08303         {
08304         strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, sizeof (dllName) - 1);
08305         }
08306 
08307     HMODULE   dll = GetModuleHandle (dllFileName);
08308 
08309     if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllArch);
08310     if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllName);
08311 
08312     for (int i = 0; !dll && i < (int) sizearr (dllPaths); i++)
08313         {
08314         char path [MAX_PATH] = "";
08315         strncpy_s (path, sizeof (path), dllPaths[i], sizeof (dllPaths[i]));
08316         size_t len = strlen (path);
08317 
08318         strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllArch, sizeof (dllArch));
08319         if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path);  //-V547
08320 
08321         strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllName, sizeof (dllName));
08322         if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path);
08323         }
08324 
08325     if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllArch);
08326     if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllName);
08327 
08328     if (!dll  && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot load library \"%s%s%s\".",
08329                                            dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
08330     if (!dll) return NULL;
08331 
08332     _tx_FARPROC addr = (_tx_FARPROC) GetProcAddress (dll, funcName);
08333 
08334     if (!addr && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot import \"%s\" from library \"%s%s%s\".",
08335                                            funcName, dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
08336     return addr;
08337     }
08338 
08339 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08340 
08341 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800) // MSVC 2013
08342     #pragma warning (push)
08343     #pragma warning (disable: 6102)          // Использование 'name' из завершившегося ошибкой вызова функции
08344 #endif
08345 
08346 int txRegQuery (const char* keyName, const char* valueName, void* value, size_t szValue)
08347     {
08348     if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (keyName)) return 0;
08349 
08350     HKEY hive = NULL;
08351 
08352     #define EQU_(name1, name2)  ( _strnicmp (keyName, name1 "\\", sizeof (name1)) == 0 || \
08353                                   _strnicmp (keyName, name2 "\\", sizeof (name2)) == 0 )
08354 
08355     if      (EQU_("HKLM", "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE"))  hive = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE;
08356     else if (EQU_("HKCU", "HKEY_CURRENT_USER"))   hive = HKEY_CURRENT_USER;
08357     else if (EQU_("HKCR", "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT"))   hive = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT;
08358     else if (EQU_("HKU",  "HKEY_USERS"))          hive = HKEY_USERS;
08359     else if (EQU_("HKCC", "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG")) hive = HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG;
08360 
08361     else { _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (("keyName должно начинаться с HKLM\\, HKCU\\, HKCR\\, HKU\\ или HKCC\\ ", hive)); return 0; }
08362 
08363     #undef EQU_
08364 
08365     keyName = strchr (keyName, '\\') + 1;  //-V769
08366     assert (keyName > (const char*) 1);
08367 
08368     HKEY  key  = NULL;
08369     DWORD size = 0;
08370 
08371     bool                               ok  = !!RegOpenKeyEx    (hive, keyName,   0, KEY_QUERY_VALUE, &key)         == ERROR_SUCCESS;
08372     if (ok)                            ok &= !!RegQueryValueEx (key,  valueName, NULL, NULL, NULL,          &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS;
08373     if (ok && value && size < szValue) ok &= !!RegQueryValueEx (key,  valueName, NULL, NULL, (BYTE*) value, &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS;  //-V104
08374     if (key)                           ok &= !!RegCloseKey     (key);
08375 
08376     return size;
08377     }
08378 
08379 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800)
08380     #pragma warning (pop)
08381 #endif
08382 
08383 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08384 
08385 //}
08386 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08387 
08388 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08389 
08390 HWND txCreateWindow (double sizeX, double sizeY, bool centered /*= true*/)
08391     {
08392 $1  if (!_txInitialized) _txInitialized = _txInitialize();
08393 
08394 $   if (HWND wnd = txWindow())
08395         {
08396 $       SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0);
08397 $       _TX_ON_DEBUG (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования уже создано!"));
08398 $       return wnd;
08399         }
08400 
08401 $   if (!_txIsDll)
08402         {
08403 $       _txMain = ! FindAtom ("_txMain");  // Not a thread-safe
08404 $       (void)       AddAtom ("_txMain");  //-V530
08405         }
08406 
08407 $   if (_txWindowUpdateInterval < 10) {$ _txWindowUpdateInterval = 10; }  //-V1048
08408 
08409 $   _txRunning = false;
08410 
08411     // Store the size
08412 
08413 $   static SIZE size = { ROUND (sizeX), ROUND (sizeY) };
08414 $   if (centered) { size.cx *= -1; size.cy *= -1; }
08415 
08416     // In Thread, where REAL creation lies...
08417 
08418 $   unsigned id = 0;
08419 $   _txCanvas_Thread = (HANDLE) Win32::_beginthreadex (NULL, 0, _txCanvas_ThreadProc, &size, 0, &id);
08420 
08421 $   if (!_txCanvas_Thread) return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot start canvas thread."),  (HWND) NULL;
08422 
08423 $   _txWaitFor (_txRunning, 10*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08424 
08425 $   if (!_txRunning)       return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot create canvas window."), (HWND) NULL;
08426 $   if (!txOK())           return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Canvas window is not OK."),     (HWND) NULL;
08427 
08428 $   HWND console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08429 
08430 $   DWORD proc = 0;
08431 $   GetWindowThreadProcessId (console, &proc);
08432 
08433 $   if (console && (proc == GetCurrentProcessId() || _txIsParentWaitable()))
08434         {$ ShowWindow (console, _txConsoleMode); }
08435 
08436 $   HMENU menu = GetSystemMenu (txWindow(), false);
08437     if (menu) {$ CheckMenuItem (menu, _TX_IDM_CONSOLE, (console? (IsWindowVisible (console)? MF_CHECKED : 0) : MF_DISABLED)); }
08438 
08439 $   Win32::GdiSetBatchLimit (1);
08440 
08441 $   SetLastError (0);
08442 
08443 $   errno = 0;
08444 
08445     #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
08446 $   _doserrno = 0;
08447     #endif
08448 
08449 $   return txWindow();
08450     }
08451 
08452 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08453 
08454 HWND txCreateExtraWindow (CREATESTRUCT createData)
08455     {
08456 $1  if (_TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) return NULL;
08457 
08458 $   volatile HWND wnd = NULL;
08459 $   createData.hInstance = (HINSTANCE)(uintptr_t) &wnd;
08460 
08461 $   PostMessage (txWindow(), _TX_WM_CREATEWND, 0, (LPARAM) &createData) asserted;
08462 
08463 $   _txWaitFor (wnd, 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08464 
08465 $   return wnd;
08466     }
08467 
08468 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08469 
08470 bool txSetDefaults (HDC dc /*= txDC()*/)
08471     {
08472 $1  if (dc == txDC()) txUpdateWindow (false);  //-V601
08473 $   txAutoLock _lock;
08474 
08475 $   RECT r = {};
08476 $   GetClientRect (Win32::GetConsoleWindow(), &r);
08477 $   SIZE szCon = { r.right - r.left, r.bottom - r.top };
08478 
08479 $   HANDLE out = GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
08480 
08481 $   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {{80, 25}, {}, 0, {0, 0, 80-1, 25-1}, {80, 25}};
08482 $   GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (out, &con);
08483 
08484 $   SIZE szTxt = { (short) (con.srWindow.Right  - con.srWindow.Left + 1),
08485                    (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom - con.srWindow.Top  + 1) };
08486 
08487 //{ Set defaults for graphics layer
08488 
08489 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_PEN),   dc) asserted;
08490 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_BRUSH), dc) asserted;
08491 
08492 $   _txBuffer_Select (Win32::CreateFont (szCon.cy/szTxt.cy, szCon.cx/szTxt.cx,
08493                                          0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
08494                                          RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
08495                                          DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, _txConsoleFont),
08496                       dc) asserted;
08497 
08498 $  (Win32::SetTextColor      (dc, TX_WHITE) != CLR_INVALID) asserted;
08499 $   Win32::SetBkMode         (dc, TRANSPARENT)              asserted;
08500 
08501 $   Win32::SetROP2           (dc, R2_COPYPEN)               asserted;
08502 $   Win32::SetStretchBltMode (dc, HALFTONE)                 asserted;
08503 
08504 //}
08505 
08506 $   if (dc != txDC())
08507         {$ return true; }
08508 
08509 //{ Set defaults for console  layer
08510 
08511 $   POINT szCanvas = txGetExtent (dc);
08512 
08513 $   HGDIOBJ font = txFontExist (_txConsoleFont)?
08514                        Win32::CreateFont (szCanvas.y/szTxt.cy, szCanvas.x/szTxt.cx,
08515                                           0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
08516                                           RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
08517                                           DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, _txConsoleFont)
08518                        :
08519                        Win32::GetStockObject (SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT);
08520 
08521 $   _txBuffer_Select (font, _txCanvas_BackBuf[1]);
08522 //}
08523 
08524 //{ Scroll the console for text to go above top of window and don't mix with graphics
08525 
08526 $   if (con.dwCursorPosition.X) _putch ('\n');
08527 
08528 $   short delta = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - con.srWindow.Top);
08529 
08530 $   con.srWindow.Top    = (short) (con.srWindow.Top    + delta);
08531 $   con.srWindow.Bottom = (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom + delta);
08532 
08533 $   SMALL_RECT src  = { 0, 0, (short) (con.dwSize.X - 1), (short) (con.dwSize.Y - 1) };
08534 $   CHAR_INFO  fill = { {' '}, FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY };
08535 $   COORD      dest = { 0, (short) -delta };  // New UL-corner of src, scroll up
08536 
08537 $   con.dwCursorPosition.X = 0;
08538 $   con.dwCursorPosition.Y = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - delta);
08539 
08540 $   (con.srWindow.Bottom < con.dwSize.Y &&                        // Move the "window"
08541      SetConsoleWindowInfo      (out, true, &con.srWindow))
08542     ||
08543     (ScrollConsoleScreenBuffer (out, &src, NULL, dest, &fill),    // Or scroll the buffer
08544      SetConsoleCursorPosition  (out, con.dwCursorPosition));
08545 //}
08546 
08547 $   txUpdateWindow (true);  //-V601
08548 
08549     return true;
08550     }
08551 
08552 #endif // TX_COMPILED
08553 
08554 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08555 
08556 inline bool txOK()
08557     {
08558     return (_txCanaryFirst == 0x776F656D &&  // Too well-known values to use constants. You know these values, don't you?
08559             _txCanaryLast  == 0x5E2E2E5E &&
08560             _txCanvas_OK()
08561 
08562     #if defined (_MSC_VER)
08563          && _CrtCheckMemory()
08564     #endif
08565             );
08566     }
08567 
08568 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08569 //{          Cleanup
08570 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08571 
08572 #ifndef TX_COMPILED
08573 
08574 // Implicit std(MSVCRT.dll)::_cexit() call before _txCleanup can lead to hangs in _cexit handlers chain.
08575 // So redefining ::std::_cexit(). Do it dynamically via PE Import Table hook to avoid duplicate symbols
08576 // if several modules linked together include TXLib.h. See _txSetProcAddress() call in _txInitialize().
08577 
08578 void _txOnCExit()
08579     {
08580     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08581     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s() called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__);
08582 
08583 $5  _txCleanup();
08584 
08585     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::_cexit()\n", _TX_VERSION);
08586     _TX_CALLv (Win32::_cexit, ());
08587     }
08588 
08589 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08590 
08591 void _txOnExit (int retcode)
08592     {
08593     if (retcode != 0)
08594         {
08595         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08596         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08597         }
08598 
08599 $5  _txCleanup();
08600 
08601     if (retcode != 0)
08602         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::exit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08603 
08604     Win32::exit (retcode);
08605     }
08606 
08607 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08608 
08609 void _txOnExitProcess (unsigned retcode)
08610     {
08611     if (retcode != 0)
08612         {
08613         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08614         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08615         }
08616 
08617 $5  _txCleanup();
08618 
08619     if (retcode != 0)
08620         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::ExitProcess (%u)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08621 
08622     Win32::ExitProcess (retcode);
08623     }
08624 
08625 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08626 
08627 bool _txOnTerminateProcess (HANDLE process, unsigned retcode)
08628     {
08629     if (retcode != 0)
08630         {
08631         OutputDebugString ("\n");
08632         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%p, %u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, process, retcode);
08633         }
08634 
08635 $5  _txCleanup();
08636 
08637     if (retcode != 0)
08638         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::TerminateProcess (0x%p, %u)\n", _TX_VERSION, process, retcode);
08639 
08640     return Win32::TerminateProcess (process, retcode);
08641     }
08642 
08643 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08644 
08645 void _txOnFatalExit (int retcode)
08646     {
08647     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08648     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
08649 
08650 $5  _txCleanup();
08651 
08652     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalExit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08653     _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalExit, (retcode));
08654 
08655     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
08656     Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), retcode);
08657     }
08658 
08659 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08660 
08661 void _txOnFatalAppExitA (unsigned action, const char message[])
08662     {
08663     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08664     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u, \"%s\") called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, action, message);
08665 
08666 $5  _txCleanup();
08667 
08668     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalAppExitA (%u, %s)\n", _TX_VERSION, action, message);
08669     _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalAppExitA, (action, message));
08670 
08671     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION);
08672     Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
08673     }
08674 
08675 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08676 
08677 BOOL WINAPI _txOnConsoleCtrlEvent (DWORD type)
08678     {
08679     OutputDebugString ("\n");
08680     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%04lX) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) type);
08681 
08682 $5  switch (type)
08683         {
08684         case CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT:
08685         case CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT: $ _txExit = true;
08686                                   $ _txCleanup();
08687         case CTRL_C_EVENT:
08688         case CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT:
08689         case CTRL_BREAK_EVENT:
08690 
08691         default:                  break;  //-V2522
08692         }
08693 
08694 $   return false;
08695     }
08696 
08697 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08698 
08699 void _txCleanup()
08700     {
08701     if (!_txInitialized) return;
08702     else _txInitialized = false;  //-V601
08703 
08704 $3  _txRunning = false;
08705 $   _txConsole_IsBlinking = false;
08706 
08707 $   HWND canvas     = txWindow();
08708 $   HWND console    = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08709 $   unsigned thread = GetCurrentThreadId();
08710 
08711 $   HWND wnd        = (canvas)? canvas : console;
08712 
08713 $   bool externTerm = (thread != _txMainThreadId &&
08714                        thread != _txCanvas_ThreadId);
08715 $   DWORD parent = 0;
08716 $   int  isParentWaitable = _txIsParentWaitable (&parent);
08717 $   bool waitableParent   = !externTerm && isParentWaitable;
08718 
08719 $   if (canvas)
08720         {$ txSleep (5*_txWindowUpdateInterval); }
08721 
08722 $   if (_txConsole)
08723         {
08724 $       if (_txMain) txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
08725 $       if (console) EnableWindow (console, true);
08726         }
08727 
08728 $   if (_txMain && !externTerm && wnd != NULL)
08729         {$ _txSetFinishedText (wnd); }
08730 
08731 $   std::cout.flush();
08732 $   std::cerr.flush();
08733 $   std::clog.flush();
08734 $   _flushall();
08735 
08736 $   bool paused = false;
08737 $   if (((canvas? _txMain : _txConsole) && !_txExit) || (_txErrors && thread == _txMainThreadId))
08738         {
08739 $       if (wnd)
08740             {
08741             if (isParentWaitable >= 0) {$ SetWindowPos (wnd, HWND_NOTOPMOST, 0, 0, 0, 0, SWP_NOMOVE | SWP_NOSIZE | SWP_SHOWWINDOW); }
08742 $           EnableWindow (wnd, true);
08743             }
08744 
08745 $       if (console && isParentWaitable >= 0)
08746             {
08747 $           _txPauseBeforeTermination (canvas);
08748 $           paused = true;
08749             }
08750         }
08751 
08752 $   if (_txWatchdogTimeout >= 0)
08753      {$ Win32::_beginthread (_txWatchdogTerminator, 0, &_txWatchdogTimeout); }
08754 
08755 $   if (txWindow())
08756         {$ SendNotifyMessage (txWindow(), WM_DESTROY, 0, 0); }
08757 
08758 $   _txWaitFor (!txWindow(), 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
08759 
08760 $   txSpeak     (NULL);
08761 $   txPlayVideo (NULL);
08762 
08763 $   if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txMainThreadId)
08764         {$ SuspendThread (_txMainThread);    }  //-V720
08765 $   if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txCanvas_ThreadId)
08766         {$ SuspendThread (_txCanvas_Thread); }  //-V720
08767 
08768 $   if (_txMainThread)
08769         {$ CloseHandle (_txMainThread)    asserted; _txMainThread    = NULL; }
08770 $   if (_txCanvas_Thread)
08771         {$ CloseHandle (_txCanvas_Thread) asserted; _txCanvas_Thread = NULL; }
08772 
08773 $   if (!txWindow())
08774         {$ DeleteCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf); CRITICAL_SECTION zero = {0, -1}; _txCanvas_LockBackBuf = zero; }
08775 
08776 $   console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
08777 
08778 $   if (_txMain && _txConsole)
08779         {$ _txConsole_Detach (waitableParent && !externTerm); }  //-V560
08780 
08781 $   if (waitableParent && paused && _txNOP (_TX_ALLOW_KILL_PARENT))
08782         {
08783 $       bool parentKilled = _txKillProcess (parent);
08784 
08785 $       parent = 0;
08786 $       if (!parentKilled || _txIsParentWaitable (&parent))
08787             {$ PostMessage (console, WM_CHAR, '\n', 0); }
08788         }
08789 
08790 $   std::cout.flush();
08791 $   std::cerr.flush();
08792 $   std::clog.flush();
08793 $   _flushall();
08794 
08795 $   _txSymGetFromAddr (NULL);
08796 
08797     _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
08798                   OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - FINISHED: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
08799                   OutputDebugString ("\n"));
08800     }
08801 
08802 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08803 
08804 int _txSetFinishedText (HWND wnd)
08805     {
08806     struct tools
08807         {
08808         static LRESULT getWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[], size_t size)
08809             {
08810 $3          memset (text, 0, size * sizeof (*text));
08811 
08812 $           return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_GETTEXT, (WPARAM) size, (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
08813             }
08814 
08815         static LRESULT setWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[])
08816             {
08817 $1          return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_SETTEXT, 0,             (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
08818             }
08819         };
08820 
08821 $1  static wchar_t title [_TX_BUFSIZE+15] = L"TXLib";
08822 
08823 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08824 $   int len = (int) wcslen (title); if (len >= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE) len = _TX_BUFSIZE-1;
08825 
08826 $   MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [ЗАВЕРШЕНО]", -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
08827 
08828 $   tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
08829 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08830 $   if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == (wchar_t) 0x0417 /* 'З' */) return 0;
08831 
08832 $   MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [FINISHED]",  -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
08833 
08834 $   tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
08835 $   tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
08836 $   if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == /* 'F' */ (wchar_t) 0x0046) return 1;
08837 
08838 $   return 2;
08839     }
08840 
08841 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08842 
08843 void _txPauseBeforeTermination (HWND canvas)
08844     {
08845 $3  while (_kbhit()) (void)_getch();
08846 
08847 $   CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {};
08848 $   bool kbRedir = !GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE), &con);
08849 $   bool kbWait  = (_txGetInput() == EOF);
08850 $   bool wine    = !!Win32::wine_get_version;
08851 
08852 $   if (kbWait && !kbRedir && !wine)
08853         {
08854 $       txSetLocale();
08855 
08856 $       if (!_txErrors)
08857             {
08858 $           if (!canvas)
08859                 {$ fprintf (stderr, "\n" "[Нажмите любую клавишу для завершения]"); }
08860             }
08861         else
08862             {
08863 $           fprintf        (stderr, "\n" "[Press F to Pay Respects...]");  // https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/press-f-to-pay-respects
08864             }
08865 
08866 $       fflush (stderr);
08867 $       txSleep();
08868         }
08869 
08870 $   for (int i = 1; ; i++)  //-V2530
08871         {
08872 $       Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval);
08873 
08874         if (!kbWait || (kbRedir && !canvas)) {$ break; }  // No need to run and hide
08875 
08876         if (!wine && _txGetInput() != EOF)   {$ break; }  // Somebody hit something.
08877 
08878         if (canvas && !_txCanvas_ThreadId)   {$ break; }  // There was a window, and now there is not.
08879 
08880         if (!Win32::GetConsoleWindow())      {$ break; }  // Console was destroyed
08881 
08882         if (_TX_CALL (Win32::GhostWindowFromHungWindow, (canvas)))
08883             {$ TX_ERROR ("Программа зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
08884 
08885         if (canvas && _TX_CALL (Win32::IsHungAppWindow, (canvas)))
08886             {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа-таки зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
08887 
08888         if (canvas && !SendMessageTimeout (canvas, WM_NULL, 0,0, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL))
08889             {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа не отвечает и будет завершена.");  break; }
08890 
08891         if (!wine && !(i % 100500))
08892             {$ fprintf (stderr, "\r" "[Так нажмите же какую-нибудь клавишу для моего завершения]"); }
08893         }
08894 
08895 $   while (!wine && _kbhit()) (void)_getch();
08896 
08897 $   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
08898     }
08899 
08900 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08901 
08902 int _txGetInput()
08903     {
08904 $4  HANDLE con = GetStdHandle (STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
08905 
08906 $   DWORD nChars = 0;
08907 $   if (GetConsoleMode (con, &nChars) == 0 &&
08908         PeekNamedPipe  (con, NULL, 0, NULL, &nChars, NULL))
08909         {
08910 $       return (nChars)? fgetc (stdin) : EOF;
08911         }
08912 
08913 $   if (_kbhit())
08914         {
08915 $       return _getch();
08916         }
08917 
08918 #if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER < 1700)
08919 
08920 $   if (fseek (stdin, 1, SEEK_CUR) != EOF)
08921         {
08922 $       (void) fseek (stdin, -1, SEEK_CUR);
08923 $       return fgetc (stdin);                              // This causes blocking in MSVC 2011 beta
08924         }
08925 
08926 #endif
08927 
08928 $   return EOF;
08929     }
08930 
08931 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08932 
08933 int _txIsParentWaitable (DWORD* parentPID /*= NULL*/)
08934     {
08935 $4  PROCESSENTRY32* info = _txFindProcess();
08936 $   if (!info) return 0;
08937 
08938 $   info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID);
08939 $   if (!info) return 0;
08940 
08941 $   char parent [MAX_PATH] = "";
08942 $   strncpy_s (parent, sizeof (parent), info->szExeFile, sizeof (parent) - 1);
08943 $   if (parentPID) *parentPID = info->th32ProcessID;
08944 
08945 $   info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID);          // info: grandparent
08946 
08947 $   char list[_TX_BUFSIZE] = _TX_WAITABLE_PARENTS;
08948 $   char* ctx = NULL;
08949 
08950 $   for (char* p = strtok_s (list, ", ", &ctx); p; p = strtok_s (NULL, ", ", &ctx))
08951         {
08952 $       char* gp = strchr (p, ':');
08953 
08954 $       if (gp)
08955             {
08956 $           *gp++ = 0;
08957 
08958 $           if (_stricmp (p, parent) != 0) { continue; }
08959 
08960 $           if (info) if (_stricmp (gp, info->szExeFile) == 0)  // Was &&, but MSVC /analyze is so paranoid
08961                 {$ return islower ((unsigned char) *gp)? +1 : -1; }
08962             }
08963         else
08964             {
08965 $           if (_stricmp (p, parent) == 0)
08966                 {$ return islower ((unsigned char)  *p)? +1 : -1; }
08967             }
08968         }
08969 
08970 $   return 0;
08971     }
08972 
08973 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
08974 
08975 void _txWatchdogTerminator (void* timeout)  // Or Watchcat? Possibly will change in future versions
08976     {
08977 $3  if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (timeout)) return;
08978 
08979 $   Sleep (*(int*) timeout);  //-V206
08980 
08981 $   OutputDebugString ("\n");
08982     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Timeout (%d) expired, activating. %s\n",  // Kinda static reflection...
08983                          _TX_VERSION, __func__, *(int*) timeout, ((__func__[8] == 'd')? "Bark, bark" : "Meow, meow"));  //-V206
08984 $   DWORD parent = 0;
08985 $   if (_txIsParentWaitable (&parent))
08986         {
08987         txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling _txKillProcess (0x%04lu)\n",
08988                              _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) parent);
08989 
08990 $       _txKillProcess (parent);
08991 
08992 $       PostMessage (GetConsoleWindow(), WM_CHAR, '\n', 0);
08993         }
08994 
08995     txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__);
08996 $   Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
08997     }
08998 
08999 #endif // TX_COMPILED
09000 
09001 //}
09002 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
09003 
09004 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
09005 //{          Tools
